text:
Our last stop on the Arizona Brewpub trail.  FATE did not disappoint.  It had the most interesting and varied Beers by far.

Strawberry Rhubarb Berliner Weisse!  A beer that smells like cheese - which I wouldn't think would be a good thing - but what do you know..  So Good.  Try a Chocolate Chili Milk Stout for dessert. Waiter told us that they keep the beer selection pretty fresh - coming up with new ideas all the time.

20 minute wait on Thursday night was OK.  Staff was friendly.  Pizza, Burgers and Salads held the standards well above average bar fare.  Kind of "out of the way" in a little strip mall, it was worth the trip.

Nice little spot with friendly staff, good music and great pizza. Had the Rustica and the pepperoni pizza. Both were really friggin good! 
Also had tiramisu for dessert that was absolutely decadent. Food here is fantastic, hands down.

Good food, good beer, friendly service! The guys that work there are super friendly, but not annoying. It's a small place so it can get crowded pretty fast.

I really like the goat cheese cranberry salad. The sausage fennel pizza is also very delish.
The toasted mozz is by far my favorite appetizer. I sometimes put my salad in between the toasted mozz. Soo good.

That's pretty much my order every time. I always have a great time when I come here.

McFates had an enjoyable, low key atmosphere, excellent thin crust pizza and pretty darn good beer. Their session IPA clocked in at only 3%, but did not taste thin. If your looking for something you can drink several of and still keep it together, this fits the bill. Their stout and regular IPA were also quite good. However, the Berliner-Weiss was under-carbonated - almost flat. The bartender was very pleasant and recommended a terrific pizza. I will certainly be back when I am in the area.
Our second visit and everything was wonderful - great beer, food and friendly, attentive service.   Plan on many more visits and will highly recommend this establishment to our friends.

I have been here twice. My second visit re-affirmed my original impressions.  Relatively disappointing as far as breweries go.  As others have noted, a long list of beers but only a few on tap (although they do have guest beers).  I think their beer tastes average at best (but I will admit that this is my personal opinion, everyone likes different things). The menu is limited to wood fired pizza and salads.  I've tried a couple different pizzas and neither was very memorable.  The service is good though and everyone is friendly, so that's a plus.
Beers were delicious, a little pricey, but delicious nonetheless. Didn't try the food but it seemed like everyone else was enjoying their pizza.

Enjoyed the beer. Really liked the choc chili stout, but ended up with the hefe as the stout is a bit spicy. The pizza was incredible! We got the rustica which was really good! Excellent service. Omg, the tiramisu was one of the best I've had!

No cider? Really?

Their wine selection is pretty good and the staff was very friendly. Also the place is nicely designed. It gets busy pretty quickly. Can't comment on the food as I didn't have any.

Drove 20 minutes last weekend to get my Fate growlette filled with their new Honey Double IPA.  The bartender said they only had one keg left and weren't filling any to-go orders.  In fact, they only had four Fate beers available and they were only filling jugs with the Sour IPA (which is nasty).  What's the difference if I sat at the bar and had two glasses of Honey Double IPA or filled my growlette with the same amount?  I wasted 40 minutes of driving.  There's a new brewery opening up the street soon.  I doubt I'll be going back to Fate anytime soon.

I have been here 3 times over the last 6 months. Every trip has been a good experience. Pizza is wood fired and tasty. Menu is small but come on, ur here for the beer!. Beer options are always solid. Always something new. Location is tight so seating can be limited. Staff has been knowledgeable and speedy. Solid Option
First visit review.  Love the atmosphere, decent beer and the best warm pretzel I have either had.  I will be back.
Awsome as always, the pizza is fantastic, service is great.  We prefer the atmosphere of this location over the Scottsdale location.
Great place to grab a beer and watch the game. Their beer will only get better. Their food menu needs a little work, but the pizzas are solid enough.
Small place but like the people who run it.  Beer selection is ok.  We have tried place a couple of times and each time like it a little better.. we haven't tried the food but it looks really good

We showed up pretty late on Valentine's night and we were blown away at the tap selection, menu and service. I had two of the IPAs and walked away with a growler to take home. We had a couple of half salads and a plate to share and everything was amazing and a great compliment to the beer. Beyond the amazing beer and food - our server was top notch. She was really super well versed on the entire menu, made great recommendations and really took the time to make us feel welcome.

We went to Fate for the first time tonight and we will definitely be back......soon!!! I went with my husband and young son and we all had different pizzas and they were all great....sausage, margarita and the kids cheese. The beers were also way above par- I had the irish red and it was great! My husband tried several and found them all to be very yummy. Can't wait to go back and try the others. Our server, Alisha was awesome! She was very friendly, attentive and very sweet to my son. Great job and if you haven't tried Fate- you should!!!

Intéressante microbrasserie!
Les bières sont brassées sur place, variées et excellentes.
Le quartier laisse un peu à désirer c'est plutôt "style centre d'achat" comme endroit mais bon... c'est Phoenix. Faut pas trop en demander à cet égard.
Les prix sont très raisonnable et bonne musique!
Je recommande. (4.5/5)
Best pizza-brewery in town. Customer service is always great. Excellent atmosphere and reasonably priced. Take the time to check out this wonderful brewery.

This local brewery is a must visit!

The Food is incredible. The Breads n' Spreads are simply outstanding and the Chicken Ceasar is one of the best I've had around. The best of the best though is the Popper Pizza - it's lights out!

The only reason it gets 4 stars instead of 5 is because they don't have a solid light beer. The cream ale (lightest) takes more like a pale ale with how hoppy it is. Either way I can usually find a good beer from another company on tap, but it would be perfect if they had their own solid light beer.
Awesome atmosphere, great food, great beer. DEFINITELY suggest trying it out. we're from out of town, drove by and decided to spend Friday night here. Highly Recommend locals to stop by.

We started out really excited to go to this place, but left feeling sort of deflated about the customer service. 

The decor looked great, background music was a nice indie blend and the place was clean.

When I asked our waitress about the beer selection and that I primarily prefer belgian and wheat ales, she said she couldn't really help me because she only liked hoppy beers since she started working there. She didn't tell me about any of the guest ales on tap (there was an Orange Blossom) or to even help to explain about any of the house beers that would have a low IBU (International Bitterness Units). So I ordered the house root beer. Not bad.

We ordered a pizza for dinner and it was pretty good, but then we waited and waited for the waitress to come around and ask us if we wanted dessert (we did), but she brought us the check (on a slow night with about 12 people in the restaurant) and left before we could even ask her about the desserts. My husband had to go over to the dessert case to get the owner to order our dessert for us. And the tiramisu was really lacking.

Bottom line: For a brewery/restaurant that has been open for more than a few months, I expect better service and consistency than this. Get it together.

Parent Perspective: Two high chairs available (that I saw), two items for the kids' menu and no changing table in the bathroom.

Disclaimer: didn't eat here, just stopped for drinks. Atmosphere was great. Service very friendly and pleasant. Beers were well done. Saw a lot of food going around and I have to say it looked fantastic. Great little place.

I've been wanting to try this place ever since the sign first went up, as you can never have too many local breweries.  After eating there, though, I'm a little torn on the rating.  On the one hand, the service was quite good and the place had a nice vibe to it, almost a buzz.  The restaurant is fairly open air and even though we were sat inside, we were close enough to the patio to enjoy this aspect.  In addition, I thought that the food was top notch for a small brewery.  They only have salads and pizza, but both the house salad and the Sunny Side pizza we tried were both interesting and flavorful.  The salad had a great mix of textures and was topped with just the right amount of dressing.  

Unfortunately, I was disappointed in the beers and feel that most of the other breweries in town and down the way in Tucson are better.  Their selection was small but not miniscule, as they had five of their own brews on tap and another handful of guest brews.  Neither my wife or I like hoppy, bitter beers-which I find that many smaller breweries tend to focus on-so this immediately cut out selection down to about half.  We sampled their hefeweizen, which we both agreed was underwhelming, as well as one of the light rotator beers that turned out to be nearly flavorless.  Feeling that the American brown would be a fairly safe choice at 36BTUs, I went for a pint of this.  Unfortunately I didn't care for this either, as it was far more bitter than expected and frankly just not that good in my opinion.  

Overall I'd still recommend trying this place, given the quality of the food.  I was mainly disappointed in that it seems to appeal to a narrower group of beer drinkers, but at the same time, I can't dock it too much for this as I'm sure many will find their beers to be appealing.  If anyone has been to Borderlands Brewing in Tucson, I think this would be an apt comparison; personally I can't stand any of their beers but I know a lot of people who love it there.
Love this place. I've been here a handful of times and the beer selection is always fantastic. Cool, relaxed local atmosphere. Wood fired pizzas are always an awesome accompaniment to the beer.

I spent the week of Thanksgiving in Phoenix visiting family, so naturally I wanted to try some of the new craft beers being produced in Phoenix.  I moved away from Arizona in 2005 and at that time the craft beer scene was as dry as [insert name of any wash/creek/stream in the Phoenix area here].  I currently live in one of the better known small town craft beer havens, and I routinely visit one of the others up north, so I've become a little bit spoiled when it comes to good beer.

I will not name the other local brewers that I tried prior to visiting Fate, but I won't hesitate to say that I was becoming very disappointed in what Phoenix had to offer in the way of craft beer.  Unoriginal, uninspired, overly hopped IPAs; unoriginal, uninspired, flat pale ales; and drab, flavorless Hefes everywhere.  I had one of the worst Ambers I've ever had the displeasure of putting in my mouth.  I tried quite a few on draft, some from bottles, and some from cans...all less than impressive.  I had read good things about Fate and as fate would have it (see what I did there?), the last night of my trip allowed me, my sexy beer nerd fiancee, and my sister to make a trip to the brewery.

Fate completely crushed every other brewer I tried while in town.  I started with a flight (Irish Red, Oatmeal Pale, Oatmeal Double IPA, Candy Bar Milk Stout, and a barrel aged double stout), all of them were flavorful, well-crafted, and easy to drink.  I went with a full pour of the Oatmeal Pale, it was that good.  I drank it while eating my delicious wood-fired pizza, it complimented perfectly.  For dessert, I went with a full pour of the barrel aged double stout.  It was definitely the winner of the night for me; aromatic, full-bodied, perfect balance of roast and sweet with just enough of a whiskey kick at the end to prove it was barrel aged.  It was surprisingly smooth for the high ABV.  

Bottom line, if you truly love beer that is well made, tastes like it should, and won't leave you wishing you had just ordered a water and saved the $5-6, you must go to Fate.  They clearly know what they are doing and are producing the best beer I had while visiting the Valley.

Five stars. Beer...great. food....pizza & salad, great. Staff, great. Owner Steve,  great. This is a nice, inviting place w great everything.   Micro brew in house beer. Guest beer (from other micro breweries) wine, wood fire pizza & salad. Happy  hour  4-6 Come see for yourself.

A young brewery that is doing good things. 

The space is decent sized, but I could see it getting pretty packed on the busier days. 

We got a sampler and everything we tasted was good. Nothing really jumped out at me, but nothing made me make a gross face either.

I do agree that they could dive into the realm of lighter beers, but with their size and brewing capacity, they seem like they're just sticking to the sure things as they get off the ground.

Definitely should be a stop if you're in the area brewery hopping.

We decided to sit on the patio by the heater and enjoy our beautiful Arizona weather.  I am not a beer drinker but, after all the reviews I figured I should give a beer a try.  I told the waiter what I was after (not yeasty or bitter, not too strong and a little sweet) He was so patient and brought out a couple of samples.  I loved the hefeweizen and ordered a pint of that.  My boyfriend got their home made root beer which was AMAZING (brought back memories of childhood).  

The waiter was knowledgeable and answered all our questions about the menu.  We decided on pizza and a salad.  The house salad was phenomenal.  Such fresh ingredients with a light dressing and the most wonderful mixture of crunchy and slightly spicy nuts.  I could make a meal out of it and, next time I might!  For our pizza, we got half pepperoni and half fennel sausage.  Both were excellent.  We each liked our own half a bit better so it worked out great.  You HAVE to save room for these little "cake pops.  They are lollipops that are like a cake/cookie batter with a hard coating on the outside.  They come in many flavors - snickerdoodle, mocha, peppermint red velvet, gingerbread, chocolate coconut.  We got snickerdoodle and mocha and they were both excellent.  The perfect amount for dessert when you are full but still want something sweet.  

They have only been open a week and are still working out a few bumps (the server disappeared a couple of times when we were looking for him) but overall, this was a fabulous experience.  How wonderful to have an independently owned little place like this right in our back yard.  We will definitely be back.

Had a couple beers and dinner here on a Friday night, and can't give this more than three stars. House beer list seems long but on closer examination doesn't have much variety; out of about ten there are two stouts, two reds, and lots of IPAs. Sorry, but IPAs are a dime a dozen these days, the fallback when a brewer can't think of something more imaginative. The only thing that stood out was an apricot beer that was okay, but too hoppy. The session beer was not good, poor balance - way too hoppy and no malt character at all.

The menu is trendy, full of olives and feta and all things hip and now. We had the potato nachos, which were very light on cheese, meat or anything but potatoes. I had a pizza, not impressed at all but I felt very healthy and cool eating arugula and mushrooms on a dry, cardboard crust. My companion had a salad which was average.

Service was slow and mechanical, the bartenders had friends at the bar who required the vast majority of their attention.

The food is okay. Be prepared prices are high for the food quality. I would compare the food to moderate dining. This place doesn't get to busy, kind of awkward. The beer is always good and drinks are prices fairly well. I give it 3 stars.

Fate is by far our favorite brewery in AZ. Their beer is among tops in the state. Hubby and I have very differing tastes. He likes super hoppy, I prefer lighter or sour. His favorite is the double Oatmeal IPA. I love the Hatch Chili Cream ale and the Gose they made last year was superb. I hope it comes back this year!  And the Candybar Milk Stout is worth the visit. Can't beat their beer prices either if you ask me.  And we enjoy the creativity with which they approach beer making. Even when their own beer is in short supply, the guest list is more than sufficient. And limited Fate supply should soon be a thing of the past with the new location open. 

I've seen several complaints about the menu. We've always loved the food and tried just about everything on the menu. Of course there will always be items that aren't your favorite so I'm not really sure why people give poor reviews just because they don't like the Irish Nachos? 

As far as service, Fate is our favorite place for service. We are at this point regulars. We know almost everyone by name and they treat us with the same kind of genuine respect and kindness we give to them. The feel is very laid back. So if you're expecting to feel catered to just because it's Scottsdale you will be disappointed. But trust me, if you are a good patron you will be well taken care of. 

Our almost weekly visits will continue!
Good Stuff.  Excellent food quality and great service.  Bit of a strange vibe.

Small and inviting, this is a great place to grab a beer and a bite to eat.  Their beer is great and the staff is very helpful if you do not know what you want.  The food was unique and quite good.  If you are in the area and need a craft beer fix, this is not a bad place to get that fix.

Overall a very good place!  Nice ambience, good food quality, friendly service.  The owners/managers I believed trained under Tom Hennessy of the Il Vicino and Colorado Boy brewery fame and the quality shows!  Their Pale is very, very tasty but don't construe this as that their other beers aren't also very good because they are.  We had pizzas and were impressed with interesting recipes and proper portioning of ingredients.  Our three kids aged 6-10 were along and made to feel welcome.  This is the neighborhood friendly place you are looking for when you've had enough of the overly plastic feel of Scottsdale!  Bravo and Cheers!
I don't write many reviews, but was so happy with the beer, pizza and atmosphere, I felt I had to take the time to say, don't miss out on this hidden gem!
Brandon is the best!!!! Try the Zach Attack pizza it is amazing! This place makes you feel like family.

Awesome microbrewery. Great pizza. Great service. Great ambiance! Their beer list and specialty pizzas change and are always incredible! They also have "guest beers" which are equally satisfying. Also, try the breads and spreads for an appetizer before you start on the pizza! So many different, yummy flavors!

I'm a total beer snob from Seattle, and I think Fate is one of the best craft brewers in AZ. Steve and his team make unique beers in small batches, so the list is constantly changing. It has been "discovered" so expect a crowd at peak hours, but also expect quality beer. Make a special trip if they have their Imperial IPA on tap - it's their specialty.

What a bad day to try Fate. I've been wanting to check it out for a long time. I was excited to have my cheat meal and try their beers. We show up and a notice on the door says the kitchen is closed due to their refrigerators being broken. Bummer and unfortunate for them. I had come on an empty stomach, planning to eat and drink. Now I'm in a bit of trouble. Luckily my boyfriend had eaten and could drive home. We asked if we could get se food and bring it in since they couldn't serve and we were drinking after all. The answer was a stern no with a bunch of BS added to it. You would think the liability of serving people without food would override having others food in your establishment. Guess not. 

Then there were three guys at the end of the bar. They were three of five in the place. You would think they were hard of hearing the way they were practically yelling at each other to have a conversation. Annoying. We took out tasting flights and moved to a table. 

Another couple came in and were so annoyed by the loud patrons they asked that the music be turned up to drown them out. 

Overalls not a welcoming experience. Trying to take into account what is their fault and what isn't but the customer service was no bueno and that goes a long way. 

Maybe we'll try it again some time...maybe.

The beer at this place is ok. Nothing special to where I told myself, "Wow this is amazing!". It was a beer that is beer. The food as well is ok. The pizza is nothing special and isn't as good as you would find at Humble pie for example, which has a cheaper lunch special, you get more for your money, and it doesn't take a 45 minute wait to make a six inch pizza. This place seemed like a great idea but at the end of the day it is just a mediocre place. I don't know how people can rave about it so much? It must be that the people in Scottsdale don't really know what a good craft beer tastes like.

So I've been to this brewery a few times without writing any reviews so needless to say I was slacking, but after my visit last night I've gotta put this on my yelp.

Finally tried their candy bar milk stout and I was not disappointed one bit. Definitely worth going back for, and filling a growler. The taste is pretty spot on with the name, at first my expectations were low because of previous milk stouts that tasted decent, but this one just put all those too shame!!

The munchies came on quickly after that first sip, so had one of their staff pick wood oven baked pizzas. The variety of ingredients on the menu looked a little skeptical at first but just like their beer, after the first bite I was sold! Never had a bad time or experience there and don't see me having one there ever.

Very good beers. They usually have a myriad of their own beers that have great hop- forward flavor. Their food is always delicious. Their food is centered around wood fired pizzas that do not disappoint. And try their homemade chili oil too.

I love that this place is a pinch different from the other local breweries-- brighter decor, a little more open, but still very casual.

The beer selection is great if you're into craft beers. Might not be so much if you're a Bud Light or Coors kind of beer drinker.

If you don't like the beer, you'll still LOVE the thin crust pizza. Must get the Sunny Side-- the capicola ham is delicious and the egg on top is the perfect touch. 

I'd pick this place over Four Peaks any day.

A brand new place we discovered.  The decor seemed industrial chic, yet warm and comfortable.  We ordered a few different pizzas and shared.  I couldn't pick a favorite they were all so good!

But the very best part was the beer.  I tried a few samples before choosing their pale ale with dinner and their brown for desert, some of the best local beer I've ever had!
Made me want to find a bar called Free Will. Service was, surprisingly, both sluggish and inconsiderate. Beer was just ok.

Visited FATE for the first time last night. To put it simply, this place puts the FATE in fatal. "Micro" brewery should be taken very literally. It is a teeny tiny facility with a few tables and only two TVs. I went with the intention of watching a big football game but the bartender absolutely refused to change the station. The typical scottsdale dbag tending bar was extremely aloof and offered zero pleasantries. Upon assessing the first few minutes of my experience there I decided to take my business elsewhere. I look forward to seeing what opens in this location next & I have a feeling it will be very soon.

Fate is an amazing brewery with great food. Try the Twist of fate or one of their phenomenal wood fired pizzas. The beer is out standing and they are constantly rotating in new beers which gives you the opportunity to try new things. The atmosphere is very comfortable and relaxing. If you are looking for a nice evening or have some free time in the afternoon I HIGHLY suggest stopping in.

In my top five breweries in the Phoenix area. Their IPA are always fantastic and their food is pretty good. Don't know what happened to the hummus at this location though. It seems to have disappeared. 

Recommend this place, less seating than the other location but still a lot of room to have fun. This location is clearly better and the people who work there are nice.
Great lunch spot. I had the buffalo chicken wrap and it was fantastic. Also lots of beer selections. Service was a bit slow but I'd definitely come back.

Outstanding food and the drinks are smooth with a great variety to mix and match. This was my first time in and I'll be back to taste other items on the menu.

Server was spot on for service and recommendations.

Highly recommended if you're into the microbrew touring scene.

I came into this brewery yesterday night and sat on the patio. I looked at the menu and saw the "oh my gatos" and i loved the name so mich i had to try it. The beer was fantastic. Our server AJ was fun and very knowledgeable. He recommended the jess pizza and it was amazing. This brewing is great our service was stellar. I would definitely recommend this place to all people.

Nice beers, you can tell a flavor profile through the available selections. ZERO complaints on the beer quality and flavor. Fiire oven pizza! You'll pay a little more for it for the size, but hey it's FIRE OVEN.
Limited menu to pizzas n such.
Service was exactly timely.
Happy hour late afternoon has beers for $4.40. DEAL.
I hear happy hour period is a zoo so get there early. I was there late evening.
NORTH Scottsdale vibe.... if that's your sort of thing.
Some people need to be kicked in the balls/cunny to loosen them up.
Maybe I should get famous first I guess, cuz I already have the looks, just no movie credits. .. PUH.
I prefer the approachable friendliness of SOUTH Scottsdale's Papago Brewing and Pig n Pickle. One day I'll come during happy hour party zone, they gotta be better than the sticks in the mud that were there when I was there.

Beer was decent.  Poutine was a disappointment.  Pizza was OK.

All in all, not bad, not great.
Love the patio. Service was excellent. Excellent selection of beers. Nuts and olives were fantastic. Can't wait to return and try out more if the food menu.

$3.75 pints during happy hour, what up?  I thought this place would be bigger, but it's cool just the way it is, strip-mall style.  Feels finished, though it's been open only a year.  They have 6 of their beers, and 6 guest taps, which is plenty for the size of the place.  No bottles.  I really like this place and I see what all the buzz is about in scottsdale now!
Great pizza, the Jess really good plus a couple Irish Red's!!  Great service from Fez and good music!!!

Just had a few beers, and that will be the last time I ever go there. The place was very modern and pleasing to the eye, just the way you want your local brewery to be. Bit that's the best it got. The beer was average at best, Nd I drink a lot of craft beers. The prices were a little steep for food and the menu was small. But what made my experience horrible was the guy at the entrance. He was insulting our group as we left and was very unprofessional. So we asked what his name was. He said "I'm Steve the owner" if this is true, its the last time I ever visit.

I went from giving 3 and 4 star reviews to just sharing tips, so when I post a review a few things are already evident. First it is a place worth sharing, it's an atmosphere and or menu worth mentioning, and somewhere I want others to enjoy. 
HERE YOU ARE!  Fate brewing North Scottsdale. Please come and find for yourself a little piece of culinary happiness, and a great brew.  Cheers

Wow! I am a big craft beer guy and Fate brews the best around. Their candy bar milk stout and their double IPA are in my top 5 favorite beers ever. Everything else I have had has been solid as well. Food is very good and service has always been attentive as well. I will be coming back here regularly.
This place is amazing. From its relaxing atmosphere to the best food Fate is one of our favorite spots in Scottdale!!
Good food great IPA the bar tender was friendly. Would definitely go back for another beer and wood fired pizza.
Great place.  However, as a Double Oatmeal IPA fan, I really wish this was on tap much more than it is.

What We Ordered:

1 Gingerbread Stout



1 "The Jess" pizza (garlic oil, mozzarella, baby spinach, bacon, roasted garlic, ricotta, parmesan)

Atmosphere: A

I love it at McFate's. It just feels so nice and cozy. The bar area is super cool, and we always love sitting at the hightop tables or out on the patio. It definitely has a low-key vibe, and the brick oven always adds a nice warmth and is a visual plus. 

Cleanliness: A

Easy. Not much to complain about here. Nice and clean.

Service: B+

We've been to McFate's Tap & Barrel a few times before, and service has always been awesome. This particular experience didn't match our previous visits unfortunately. It wasn't bad, but wasn't great either. Not memorable at all. Our server was a girl who didn't even bother mentioning her name, and also didn't smile once. I work in the F&B industry as a manager myself - most of my job is literally to smile and ensure people feel welcome and comfortable. Smiling is always something that should happen during a dining/drinking experience. Just didn't happen this time. On another note, she was able to snag us a few leftover gingerbread man cookies from last night's event! That was a nice touch :)

Food: B+

Food is solid. "The Jess" is a killer combo of pizza ingredients, and the pizzas are cooked well in their brick oven. In a previous visit, I also tried the Caesar Verde - a caesar salad with some pesto added to it - and it was super tasty. I like how simple they keep their food menu. It's a great way to keep customers happy (and full) while being able to relax and enjoy the true star... the BEER!

Beer: A

My first time going to McFate's I actually wasn't too impressed with the beer. I did a flight of a few random ones, and they were just OK. But then...

Then I stopped by once and got the Candy Bar Milk Stout. 

And it changed everything. 

I'm a huge fan of all things dark beer, and the Candy Bar Milk Stout is absolutely outstanding. Perfectly sweet, with salty, nutty and chocolate notes. It just doesn't get much better. One of my favorite sweet stouts is White Russian Stout by SunUp, and the Candy Bar Milk Stout is right up there with it. Totally killer. 

Sorry - I guess I kind of got off-top for this particular visit. Because the Candy Bar Milk Stout is no longer being brewed right now, I went with the gingerbread stout (one of my servers told me earlier today how fantastic it was, so choosing it was a no-brainer). The gingerbread stout was definitely a good stout, especially for the holidays. In my book it's not quite as tasty as the almighty Candy Bar Milk Stout, but again - still a solid beer for sure. 

Creativity: B+

The only way I give an establishment an "A" for creativity is if they do something totally crazy, and that's not McFate's. They are solid all the way around, and while their seasonal beers are definitely unique and delicious - they aren't anything completely nuts. Which honestly, can sometimes be a good thing. McFate's is consistent and dependable.

Visited Fate Brewery on Tuesday for
Happy hour.. Kitchen was out of service, unfortunately,however working in the F&B industry, things break and I can understand that is not always the establishments fault. That being said, everything else was great!! The beers are all very unique and delicious.. The Hatch Cream Ale was unlike anything I have ever tasted before! Service was very friendly and attentive from the bar staff. You can tell they take a lot of pride in their brewery and it shows!. Definitely will be back to try food sometime!

Really poor service.  Food was ok, but it shouldn't take 60min to get a salad.  The waitress kept forgetting us, and it wasn't even that crowded.  This is really just a bar, so stay away if you are hungry, and especially if you are on your way to a movie or on a schedule

Fate Brewery was really great experience. We went there for our friend's birthday dinner and they were very accommodating, placing us together and emailing us ahead of time to confirm head counts. When we got there the server was very nice, understanding we wanted different checks and was very fast on getting us our drinks and pizzas. They even set up a different table for all of our pizza selections, since we had so many. 
The wait for the pizzas were very short and all of the pizzas were delicious. I think between our whole group we had each one. My favorite one was the chef's specialL The Honey Bee with arugula. 
Overall the atmosphere was great. Even though it was Fourth of July, they didn't rush us out. Overall it was a great time.

Love coming here! Delicious beer and the food is incredible!
My boyfriend and I decided to try their weekly special a while ago instead of going with the pizza we usually get (the Jess) and are now addicted to the bees knees!!! Bring it back!!! It had arugula, bacon, a specialty cheese, and HONEY! It was incredible! They haven't had it since but went out of their way to make us something similar the last time we were in :D 
If you stop in here you have to get the pretzels they are the best!
Cold beer, hot food, awesome service. 
Very laid back atmosphere!

Fate Brewing Company is new to the Valley, and I was excited to try their beers. I headed in and ordered a flight. The place is small, but the beer is great! Their smoked porter is one of the best beers I have had in months. Their IPA is pretty great, too. I had the chance to try some of their beers at a beer festival and they were a highlight of our time at said festival. 

They also have wood-fired pizza here. I have had a few different pizzas, and their pizza bread is amazing. Oh, and the dipping sauce. I have no idea what it is, but it is AMAZING! I pretty much want to take a bath in it. So good. 

Fate is in a great location, too. Really excited that a new brewery has opened and they are producing good beer. And how could I forget... CAKE POPS! Yes, they serve cake pops. This place just keeps getting better. If you like good pizza and great beer, check out Fate Brewing Company. You won't be disappointed. When you are there, ask if the owner is there. He's a great guy and likes talking to fellow craft beer enthusiasts. Bottoms up, people!

Really enjoyed this place! The pizzas were very tasty and we are looking froward to try more of them. We got the jalapeño one and the truffle one, so good. 

The beers were tasty, I really enjoyed that they had other local breweries in addition to their own brews. 

The staff were very polite and attentive, we can at the end of happy hour and the place was still packed. The guy running the hostess stand said it would be about twenty, it was more then that and he came to us to apologize and explained that people are done and are just hanging out - almost right after he came we were seated.
Really good food, and great beer with a huge variety on tap.  My only grip is they only had three beers available in cans to go. Wish they had more available.

Fate is one of my favorite Micro Breweries in Phoenix. They have great pizza for a quick bite at lunch. The Mediterranean is excellent with just the right amount of kalamata olives.  The salad I had was great with blue cheese and candied pecans with sunflower seeds.  The real stand out for me is their unique beers they make and tap.  The Candy Bar Stout is just as awesome as it sounds brewed with peanuts, vanilla, and coco nibs. If you drop in to get a growler they have it on tap with nitrous and it's amazing.  The bartenders are always very friendly and willing to answer questions and fill up a growler to go. If you a re in the mood for a more standard beer check out the belgian Dubbel it's very good with everything.

Our favorite local brewery! Very unique beers and it is always exciting to try something new. I love the hatch chili cream ale and the candy milk stout is real good. Pizza is also very good and atmosphere is modern and sleek.  Service always very good too

Off to a good start...hoping they stay open since others in the area keep shutting down (adios Nimbus).  Beer selection was good - especially enjoyed the Irish Red - and the ambiance was appealing.  Pizza was fair, as my search for acceptable pizza in the valley continues.  Wish there were other options besides pizza.  Overall a good experience - rooting for this place.

The Audi Club of Arizona organized a little meet / greet happy hour at Fate Brewing recently. One of our members had heard about the place and the weather+patio+good brews and chews was the ideal mix. I contacted the manager to see about setting up a place for a group of about 10 people (we ended up with 15). Steve was welcoming and quick to respond. The day of I arrived early and Travis (I believe) guided me to the table, the wait staff was great and gave great recommendations. Individual checks were done without a blink and we all know that can be difficult when a group arrives at different times etc. All in all, excellent experience. The food, the brews, the homemade root beer, and the staff were great. The location just off of Scottsdale road and Shea was easy to navigate and with a back entrance by the additional parking made it even easier. Highly recommend!

I've been working some straight to the point reviews lately so I'm going to keep up with my current trend. Heres the 1,2,3.

The beer is on point! The Imperial IPA was the super star tonight. Just an amazing beer. All of the beer offerings were well made. Good stuff all the way around.

The pizza is MONEY!!! Wood fired, thin crust, fresh ingredients. This is what all other pizza wants to grow up to be! Possibly....the best pizza in Phoenix.Yeah, I effin said it! Loved it. We had a salad too. Great but completely overshadowed by the pizza.

Nice build out, comfortable atmosphere and friendly service. This is a great place. Check it out!

If your a wife or girlfriend trying to Appease the beer enthusiast that is your counter part I highly recommend Fate! My husband loves the beers and always tries to grab a growler to go :) i, on the other hand, love the pizza. It's the only place in town we've found that pizza is done right! When my mother in law came in from Chicago we took her here and she said the pizza is better than a lot of places back home which is a huge compliment! I'm always the DD when we come to Fate but I don't mind bc the food and atmosphere are that great :)

Love the beer (Cream Ale is my favorite) and love that they have something new every time we go.  The food is also very good and they welcome special orders which is a nice touch for picky eaters like myself.  The food menu is somewhat limited, but that does not bring my rating from 5 stars to 4 at all.

Great vibe, fun, open, nice bar, friendly staff.  Kind of like a cool, easy going neighborhood hangout.  Beer was fantastic, had the stout and irish red.  Didn't try the pizza, but will be back very soon to give that a try.  We need more of these locally owned (non corporate nationals) in the area.

Went back this weekend and had the pizza.  Two problems, 1-this place could seriously impact my waistline, as the pizza was great!!! 2- this place is becoming too popular, my favorite beer (Irish Red) was out, and wouldn't be back in the taps for another 10 days.  I think they are going to need bigger tanks, for more beer!!!

Horrible and slow service.

Just a lot of attitude from the waiter, and the beer there is really hit or miss.  Mostly miss.

The pizza is decent, but overall I just found myself really annoyed with the whole experience.  Also a bit pricey.

Great place to go for a neighborhood beer and pizza and/or salad.  We sat at the bar and the service was extremely attentive.  Pizza was hot and fresh and we liked the thin crust.  Also have a nice selection of wine if you are not a beer drinker.  This place definitely has a nice "neighborhood" feel and staff works hard to make you feel at home and enjoy your dining experience.

I came here with a friend for happy hour on a Monday, and I came and left and very happy man. Typically Monday-Friday 3-6, it was a dollar off tap beers and appetizers, which is pretty much everything I would get here regardless. The menu includes pizzas for dinner options.

Monday at 5:30 was surprisingly empty - yet when we left around 6:30 place was almost packed. Maybe people don't get beers and just get pizza?

For apps my friend shared the Irish Nachos. Basically the happy marriage between loaded potato skins and nachos, this dish I think is the standout on the menu for the reason and the one we'd get every time.

Apparently the menu rotates very fast according to some Yelpers, and true enough I can't find some of the drinks I really enjoyed. I really liked the Export Stout - good hints of a coffee like flavor without too much going on. I had a Hefeweizen I really liked too but it's off the menu and I can't find the name. 

I think this is a really nice place for the area, not as overwhelmed as other places like fourth peaks with decent bites and beers. With Raising Cane's across the street now, Fate North looks like it's headed towards my favorite's in North Scottsdale.

Clean, comfortable, unpretentious neighborhood brewery. Loved the Bavarian pretzel.  The barrel aged porter is smooth.  Travis is knowledgeable and gregarious. Good place to hang with friends.  Spacious with a good vibe. Love the skateboard truck for a tap!
Good beer.  I tried the double pale ale which was very good.  Poor, slow service and average food.  Irish nachos are a great idea but like warm and not enough bacon.
So. Damn. Good. Not a single beer we didn't like. Wish it was closer to the west side. Try the Truff Dive pizza.
Every good thing you've heard about this place is true. The staff is excellent and the beer is awesome. Try the Pizza it's the best.

Best craft brewery in the Valley.  And their food is equally good. Love the wood fired pizzas and have tried several of them over the last couple of years.  Don't pass on their house-made chili oil with your pizza - it's very good.  Their house salad is quite tasty and very fresh - I always make sure to get one.

We always sit at the bar and have a great time talking with the bartender, owner and other guests. It's just a friendly neighborhood place.  But we have fun everywhere we go.  It's a matter of attitude isn't it?

We stopped in this weekend for beer and dinner.  

While the beer had been a solid three stars before it was now a solid five stars (American Pale Ale).  Truly an exemplary example of the IPA style somewhere between the mega hopped American IPAs and English IPAs.  

Liquid Art for your enjoyment on tap.

The food was a solid three stars.  The only downside was the bread was burnt for the bread and spread appetizer.

My girlfriend and I came here because ohso and four peaks were way too crowded. Very limited beer selection but they brew it so that's understandable. They only serve pizza and salads but they were good. Little on the pricey side. I could do 3 1/2 I would.

This is an easy 5 star rating for me. Looking for tremendous beer, awesome pizza and great service? Fate Brewing is the place for you. This has such a great "neighborhood" restaurant/brewery feel that invites you in and brings a smile to your face. The employees are all incredibly nice and seem to genuinely be enjoying their job. The brews rotate often, so stop in to see what's on tap or check their Facebook page...they update new happenings quite often. The pizzas are wood fired and have nice a thin crust with very fresh toppings. Nice salads too. Cheers to the whole crew at Fate!

No complaints regarding the beer itself, but the service could be improved.  Was there on 11/28/2014 with some friends from Fort Collins (O'Dell New Belgium, Equinox, etc.) and had to run down our server more than once to find out what was going on with our order.  I did have their pale oat pale and wanted to get a growler filled, but I did not have a growler with me.  I called today (12/5/2014) to make sure they still had some and was told they did and could fill a growler, but when I got there I was told there was some miscommunication on their part and that they only had one keg left and would NOT fill a growler.  Not sure if it was due to the difference in price if they sold me 4 sinle pints as opposed to a growler, pretty disappointing.  I used to live in Fort Collins and never had this issue with any breweries there.

12/12/2014 - I have to add an update to my original review.  Fate's owner contacted me and has definitely made up for my experience, which I really appreciate his effort to make it right.  Quality Beer, quality food, and quality ownership.

Thanks Steve

I got food poisoning here during my first visit to Fate while getting a salad. But the second time around it was fine.

Food: pizzas are pretty standard, they don't wow me. Salads are good, a tad overpriced but hello, Scottsdale how are you doing?

Service: slow! Every time we came here there were like 2 people serving 10 tables. Everything took forever but I don't blame the servers though, Fate needs to get some more personnel going!

Beer: I am not a beer drinker but my friends do and most of them love it there. So the beers have to be good. Though i tried their house Root beer, pretty fantastic. Loved it.

Beer is good, but the menu is pathetic. I like their Irish red, but they were out of it when I visited last on 7/1/15.

The menu just plain sucks, so don't go there for the food. they need to serve burgers , what beer place doesn't serve burgers? Seriously!!!!!   Need to redo their entire menu and get a new chef or don't serve food at all.  We asked the waitress if the Irish Nachos were good.  Of course her lips said yes,  but her body language said no.   We could so tell she was lying.

Tasty beers and pretzel. Try the Hatch Chili beer. Austin was an awesome server!!  Very friendly environment. Enjoyed the patio with a heater. Wood fired pizzas are delicious. Happy hour doesn't include food :(

Came to Fate Brewing with my Fiancee on July 3rd and Had a bite and a flight. 

Has a bit of a restaurant feeling when you walk in. Regular tables and Bar seats to situate at. 

The brew tanks are sitting behind the glass doors so it still gives you a bit of that brewery feeling when you see them. 

Food: 
Wood fired pizza which was pretty darn good. We had the Rotating special pizza which had Spinach, Bacon, Garlic and Honey. It was surprisingly really good. 

Beers: 
Had a flight of 5 
Oh my Gatos- Golden ale- Very light. Easy to drink, very smooth. Enjoy this outside on a hot day..very refreshing. 

Single Hop Sour(cascade)- Not super sour like sours can be, the cascade hops with the citrusy flavor was a good balance. You do get that hint of  salivating sour feeling while you sip. Really good

Totes McOats- Was hoping for a little bit more IBUs out of this Pale ale. A little bit on the light side but still was enjoying when i was sipping this away. My taste buds enjoyed this one
 
American Pale ale- Really good balance of Hops in this West-Coast Pale ale. at 6.0abv and 66ibus- i was likeing this 

Rye So Serious- Now my favorite out of the 5. the RED IPA, Coming in at 70IBUs, i saved this one for last. If you like IPAs, get a pint of this. doesn't disappoint. Taste it for yourself. 

I enjoyed this brewery and liked the decor/ambiance. If this was in San Diego, i would definitely visit this place frequently. Next time my fiancee and i are in scottsdale, this will be the first stop. Ill be wearing my FATE brewing shirt too!

Keep it up FATE- Hopefully you get your beer distributed to San Diego, i would definately buy.

By far the best beer in the Valley- very personable bartenders.  Tony especially!
Wood fired pizzas are over top delicious!

Go there you won't regret it!

The brewery had a friendly atmosphere, it is a smaller venue and when we went it was absolutely packed on a Wednesday night.  The beer was innovative and I like that they sell growlers of their beers to take home.  The pizza was inspired, especially the item that had habanero honey on it. It was so good I had to get some to dip my pizza in!  The Only reason this place didn't get 5 stars from me is that it was under staffed.

Beer-wise, this is the best brew-pub I've been to in AZ, and I've been to A LOT of them.  The smoked porter was a unique idea, well-executed.  The pale ale had a great aroma and a hoppy character, but not a typical 'me-too' American ale.

Service was very attentive and friendly, though we did get a bit stranded between our salad and pizza course....  The pizza was a very nice thin-crust (not as thin as, say, Lamp's), plenty of toppings, sauce was good.  The aforementioned salad (spinach) was very tasty with a nice dressing and plenty of stuff.  My only quibble would be that a slightly larger menu would be nice -- maybe throw in a couple more topping options and a couple apps.  Focused is good, but just a little more variety would be the spice.

With all the pizza places on this particular corner, I would have expected a new place coming in to be over the top.  The margarita pizza was just sad.  Barely any cheese, made with sauce instead of fresh tomatoes, just an all around bust.  They don't have much on the menu - especially for someone gluten free.  

The wait staff was awesome.

I have not eaten here, but the wood fired pizzas look and smell amazing. I have come for the craft brew, and they do a great job. It is all small batch so your choices change often which is nice. There is a small patio, but the room opens up with garage doors to make the inside feel like the outside.

Was up in the area so stopped to check it out.

Overall good place with craft beers done in small batches. The selection at this time was not my favorite so i am going to have to go back when it aligns more with the kind of beer i like. They had seven diff ones most were too hoppy for me the standouts where the red and sour. They also have beers from other brewers to round out the selection.

Simple and clean decorations and has viewing of the brewing gear, a pretty small place in general.

Menu is basically a pizza place (have wood fired oven) with salads and bar snacks. Not wide offering but good. Pablo honey pizza was a nice change of pace.

So after i go back when they have some more stouts and balanced beers i will review again.
Great experience !  We had a blast, just my husband and I, but the staff quickly became friends!  Wish this location was closer!  Small, but a good vibe!

This place was a pleasant surprise while in Scottsdale.  Their brews are extremely well done for such a small joint, and the wood fired pizzas were exceptional.  I highly recommend this micro-brewery and restaurant.

My partner and I stumbled upon Fate yesterday and loved it! We had the Mediterranean pizza, and it is by far the best pizza we have found in the area. The pizzas are 12" and run around $11 - definitely an affordable lunch! Their hot pepper oil is incredible, too. It's a perfect balance or herbs and spiciness. I had the oatmeal stout and he had the IPA, and we were both pleased. There were quite a few beers on the list that they didn't have on tap, which was disappointing, but it gives us more incentive to go back! The place itself was incredibly clean and sleek, providing a really nice atmosphere that you don't find at most Phoenix area brewpubs. I definitely recommend Fate!

Cute little local brewery in the always-congested area of Scottsdale & Shea.  Their pretzels are dang tasty and the flights are a great deal.  To be honest, I wasn't the biggest fan of their house drafts except for the Strawberry Milkshake.

Great place, well worth your time. Food is good. Price is on par for what you would expect in Scottsdale.

Beer is very solid. The only thing I don't like is that I will often go specifically for their American Pale only to find they don't have it. They have plenty of other quality beers and I have yet to be disappointed but I still want at least 2 or 3 regular standbys for the regulars.

Love this place. Stopped in after an event at the senior dog rescue with another volunteer because Yelp brings them up on the "Bloody Mary" list. Our waiter, Fausto, looks as us dismayed because it's Saturday and they are closed Easter. They normally make Bloody Mary's on Sunday and because they will be closed, they did not get any mix. He then goes on a hunt and finds just enough mix to make one drink. 

I happily order a mimosa, my friend orders her one Bloody Mary and we survey they menu while we sit on the patio. The menu looks amazing. Our server is swamped with tables, so by the time he gets back we've decided on a pizza. His suggestions are The Jess or the Con Carne. I don't eat meat so I ask if we can do the Jess without bacon. He suggests half bacon so my friend can have it on hers. Great suggestion so she can still enjoy the full combination. 

We replenish with another round of drinks, mimosas, he keeps the water coming and our pizza arrives. It has baby spinach, ricotta, huge chunks of  sautéed garlic, cheese and bacon on her half. The crust is crispy through and through, no sog anywhere. It was phenomenal. 

After our food, we ask Fausto if they have a dog friendly patio (of course we want to know if we can bring some of the senior dogs over with 'Adopt Me' vests on to relax while we eat and get them out and about). He says absolutely, gives us his name, his managers name, and is absolutely awesome.

Overall we had an amazing meal, a great server, and we will definitely be back and would recommend.
Constantly rotating selection of creative beer and some great pizza combinations from their pizza oven.  Great variety in beer, everything we tried was good.

The beer here is nothing special at all. Most of it is the typical over-hopped, flavorless stuff that a lot of places seem to be serving these days. If it were just a tap room, I'd give it two stars at most. But the pizza is good, the service was friendly and prompt, and it's a nice place. Just don't expect much from the beer and you should be happy.
One of the best beer places around.   The IPAs rock.   I love this place.   Worth the drive.  Friendly staff and awesome beers.  Way to go STEVE!

Fate Brewery is a great addition to Arizona's local breweries. The combination of yummy fresh food plus beer is awesome, and when you can add cake pops to the mix, well it's hard to put all that happiness in words. The brewery restaurant itself is nice - lots of light, outdoor seating with a garage-type door that opens out onto a patio, view of the brewing cask/tanks, and warm soothing colors. We had:

- Garlic Pizza: Damn good! Flavorful garlic olive oil sauce, lots of cheese, and fresh basic and tomatoes. The crust is really good.
- House Salad: Always impressive when a place that serves beer can also make a good salad. Lots of cheese and other toppings, and everything was fresh.
- The Beer: Pretty good. I was a little disappointed in the Cream Ale because I was expecting a luscious creamy beer, but it wasn't. In fact I thought the Hefe was way more creamy. 

Overall, Fate Brewery is a great place to go with friends or a date or coworkers. The people working there all seemed really nice, and we had a good time there.

I stopped in to see what is new. I was hoping for the milk stout and they have prize winning candy milk stout which I enjoyed. They had an IPA which is supposed to have "enough" IBUs. It was OK. I asked about IBU numbers and was told 180 which seems improbable.  It is possible though taste buds can't detect the higher numbers so I shouldn't question it.  This is a good place to stop by when we are in Scottsdale... And we will
Stopped in for a glass of wine & a pizza. Nice place, staff super friendly, an extremely busy place! But you were well taken care of! Would absolutely go back again & the Pizza was phenomenal!

I have only stopped in here a couple of times and just had a beer both times, but I look forward to trying the food. The beer is great and the Candy Bar Milk Stout is f'n delicious! I'll be heading back this weekend for a growler of that stuff.

Staff is good and attentive. The vibe is very laid back. The kind of place that invites you sit and enjoy your beer.

Next time food, and an updated review.
It doesnt suck, the place and service is average in every way, the food is ok, pizza was decent 7 out of 10!!

We've probably been here 20+ times on a date by now and I can't say it's ever been anything less than a five star review. 

One of the best pizzas I've ever had in my life. You've got to try their habanero honey oil that they put on pizza. Holy cow. 

This place is one of a kind. Outstanding service. The bar manager is so fantastic...we are always treated very kindly and  entertained. You couldn't ask for a better neighborhood bartender. 

They have wine, root beer, and beer. Fantastic rotating beer menu. My favorite is their American IPA. 

My favorite date night spot. It's my version of serendipity ;)

Just stopped in for some beers and something to eat and O M G were we blown away. I tried 4 beers and they were all excellent, my favorite though was the Fateful IPA. We also got "the Jess" for pizza which was soooooo good! I probably could have ate one by myself it was THAT good. They also have a habanero oil that u can put on your pizza or dip -  make sure you get that shit. This place is awesome and I will totally be coming back with friends soon.

There is definitely something to say about a brewery that is frequented by patrons who work at competing breweries.  Guess they know their business and their beer.  Fate is a friendly place.  A cute bar, tables inside and out.  The staff was AMAZINGLY FRIENDLY and I am so glad we decided to sit up at the bar instead of a table.  Everyone in front and behind the bar helped us in our beer and food selection and they were spot on.  We had Irish Nacho's that are exactly what you would...sliced potatoes with a bunch of yummy stuff on top.  As for the beer selections, there are many, especially if you are a fan of fruity, citrus, chocolatey, sour, or wheat beers (which I am not).  But, it was still fun trying them all.  Check it out...you'll meet all the other breweries employees while you are there.
Slow service. I think they were short handed. The beer and food were very good. Seems like a hip place to be in Scottsdale.

I have been here four times in the past year.  This is a cute little place.  It has a small menu, but it is enough to satisfy your appetite.  This last time we were a group of 13 people and they were quickly and happy to accommodate us.  We sat in the patio area.  Our server was Fausto and he was really great.  This time I had the roasted rosemary potato pizza and a spinach salad.  It was really delicious, but Scott's fennel pizza, smelled like heaven.  I have had that one before, and I know it is amazing.  Several people ordered the potato chips nachos, they looked delicious.  I also had the Irish red beer.  I liked it.  They also offer flights of beer, which some people really liked.  I am just starting to drink beer, so I am not as adventurous with them yet.  I will definitely keep coming back.  It is a very relaxed and casual environment.
Omg this place is amazing!! I live in Gilbert but I'd drive here any day to come here for dinner!' The Jess pizza and the caprese salad was amazinf

My husband and I dropped by for happy hour a few weeks ago and this place was pretty good.
Great atmosphere and service. Also, good selection of beer. I was a little sad that they didn't offer a sour beer but I believe I had just missed it by a few days. 
We ordered the pretzel and cheese as an appetizer and a pizza for our main dish. Both were okay but just pretty plain bar food. 
I would definitely go back for the beer and atmosphere though!

Fate is the best small brewery and restaurant in the Phoenix area!  It is not even close.  Their beers are always flavorful and delicious.  There are usually at least 6 of their own beers and a few "guest" selections to choose from.  Always something for everyone.  The food is also excellent.  They could offer sharper knives for cutting the pizza.  That would be my only suggestion.  They have indoor and outdoor seating with a great concrete bar and 2 TV's with the sound off.  A "garage door" joins the inside and outside areas together.  My favorite beer selections are the Irish Red and the American Pale Ale.  Both are excellent.  Also anything with Hatch Chili's is pretty good as well.

Fausto is a great server.  If you are lucky enough to get him you will be well taken care of.

I have been to many other craft breweries in Arizona and none are as good as Fate.

The beer is good.  Very good.  At least 4 stars or so as beer goes.  They got the 5th star though for the pizza.  This is quietly one of the best pizza places in the valley (shove your Neapolitan pizza where the sun don't shine).

We decided to head to Fate for lunch to celebrate my big 3-0 birthday, based on all of the positive Yelp reviews. I'm happy to report that it didn't disappoint. The beer, pizza and cake pops were all on point. Our server was friendly and super attentive, in fact we joked that she may have Psychic powers!! I would highly recommend Fate and will definitely return the next time were in Scottsdale!

Had a great experience at Fate, the service, food and drinks were all exceptional.  We originally came in just to try the beer but after hanging out for a while and smelling the wood oven we gave in and ordered a pizza.  I am so glad we did, the pizza was one of the best I have had in quite a while.  We had the Con Carne wood fired pizza and the meat was perfect and the fresh herbs tied it all together and rounded out the flavor nicely.  We tried all of the beers that had and all were good.  My favorites were the Single Hop Sour and the Oh My Gatos Golden Ale.  Fun name as well!  If you are looking for a cool little spot with easy parking, friendly employees and great food and beer Fate will hit the spot.

Yuuuuuum. Beer and pizza was awesome! Atmosphere was fun too! The service was ok but everything else made up for it. Our kids asked to go back here twice in once week because the pizza was so good- we obliged!

This place is awesome.  It's at a great location and easy to get to.  From the moment we walk in, we are greeted with a smile and a great attitude.  We've been here twice and each time has been great.  They serve thin crust pizza.  Try the Capicola.  They also brew their own beer plus they offer guest taps, which they change up ever so often.  Everyone is friendly and we love this place.

So after my last review I have been meaning to come check out Fate Brewing again especially their food. So this time around I stopped by and had dinner on a Friday night and as usual this place was packed. I really do enjoy the laid back atmosphere and the chill music. But my taste buds just don't agree with their beer I tried a few new beers and still wasn't satisfied. To me they just don't stick out enough to want to come back not to mention there brick oven pizza is just that and nothing more. Don't get me wrong I am not trying to bash this place and I really want to like Fate but its just not happening.

I may be a tad biased, but in reality the beer is better than most I have tried. The red, cream ale and the specialty brews are the best I have had. The pizza is always on point and you can't beat the staff. You will definitely not want to miss out on this place if you are anywhere close! Here is a quick tip, call, FB, or find out what they have on tap, if they have a fan fav, people tend to drink it up fast!

Finally made it to Fate. Don't always find myself up here, but after recent visits to N. MTN Microbrewery & SunUp I was damn well excited to be walking in. At the bar we tasted a sample of the Single Hop Sour which made my socks roll up and down - twice. Wow. Nice effervescence as well. A sample of the Irish Red - solid.  A sample of the Cream Ale came with an eye roll and recommendation to order the flight. I'm sharing the samples with my wife, mind you. No worries, we are humble people, and he did provide the Cream Ale, which was lovely. But I really really wanted a sample of the Am. Pale Ale. We huddled and hatched a bold plan - go with a 50/50 mixed pint of the Sour with the Am. Pale. We were counting on the Pale to be as awesome as the Sour, and also subdue it some, so my socks only rolled up & down once. Of course the real brilliance was that we didn't need to upset Donny Darko for another sample. Well DD wasn't impressed. He lowered his head as if in pain as he poured. I tried to brighten him up - 'you must get this request often, huh?'
Sloooow painful shake of the head. 'Never'. Well buckle my chin strap if this wasn't a delightfully beautiful collision of deliciousness (and, truth be told, DD made it a 70/30 mix - no worries incentive to come back and experiment). I may never be forgiven by the Beer Gods of Etiquette (or the bartender) for my reckless behavior, but my taste buds keep asking me to go back. Hats off the the brewmaster. Fine selection indeed.

Pizzas were fantastic. We ordered the Con Carne and The Jess. These were brick oven pizzas that really lived up to the expectation. The beers were average but very true to style. I think the Fate-ality was the best. Our server was very good and knowledgable about the beers and local options.

More and more, Arizona is being bombarded by breweries, and it's becoming harder for them to stand out cause, quite frankly, a lot of the beer tastes the same, the food is typical, and the "unique" crafts just don't tickle my tastebuds. Fortunately, Fate has a couple of those standouts that would make me want to head back over there...the chili oil and the chocolate-chili milk stout! 

I know, the chili oil? Yep. It's actually packed with great flavor that goes perfectly with any of Fate's carbohydrates (I only tried the flatbread app and potato nachos -- just okay). If you ever had the pleasure of going to a restaurant named Aiello's before it closed, you'll remember their complementary chili oil app. Fate's oil reminded me of that immediately! It's just spicy enough, and it's loaded with delicious chili, oil, and oregano flavor. The chocolate-chili stout was also perfectly spicy! The first few sips were reminiscent of any tasty chocolate/coffee milk stout, but after your palate has been engulfed with it, you start to get hints of spice that build slowly while you venture to the snifter's plinth. Delicious.

I'm looking forward to checking Fate out again, and I'm hoping the service will be a little better the next time (it was busy). And, I'll be sure to try their pizza because, c'mon, I like pizza and beer! 

Salut!

This is one of the best craft beer tap rooms I have ever been to, if not the best. McFate is an institution in the Arizona craft beer community. 

For context, I started going to McFate (Fate back in the day) nearly three years ago. This neighborhood craft beer pub features excellent as well, the Jess being my personal favorite. 

Moving to the beer now... the beer is incredible, all their beers, but their IPAs belong to a different class altogether. Flip the menu to the back, to find the heavier, hoppier, bigger beer selections. Some of the crows favorites are: American Pale Ale, Fatality IPA, Double Oatmeal IPA (a photo of a double oatmeal IPA in my review). Last year (2016) they started brewing an American Pale Lager (APL) which is probably among my too 5 beers ever. 

This small pub is where they started their operations in Arizona, and they used to brew their beer here. Two dads ago (late 2015) they opened a gorgeous facility south of Old Town Scottsdale, on Scottsdale road, where they do the brewing now. I strongly recommend you to visit that facility. 

Finally, but maybe most importantly, their staff is wonderful across both locations. They're very friendly, very casual and down to earth. One of my favorite breweries in Toronto has staff that is not really friendly and that ruins the experience for you (Bellwood Brewery), so every time I'm back at McFate I really appreciate how friendly the staff is. Special mention to Fausto as his location, who is one of those friendly faces that is always up for a good chat and solid beer recommendation. 

Keep it up guys!

Solid beer, solid pizza, solid service, solid atmosphere.  Just an all around solid place to grab a pizza and a beer.  All the reviews on here seem to be spot on so there is really nothing more that I could add.

Fate mixes together two of the finer things in life. Pizza and beer and they do a hell of a job at it. The fennel sausage pizza was great, love the goat cheese. The pesto pizza also a strong choice. The beers are all very good. Love the sours when they are available.

shared pizza and beers with the family and all GREAT things.  We tried a tasting of everything and had additional sours with our food.  The pizzas are incredible and the servers are super friendly.   Real comfortable place.

We stopped in after a movie to check out the "soft" opening.  They have it together with friendly and attentive staff.  Pizza was excellent--great flavor and fast delivery out of their great looking wood burning oven.  Their local brews taste great--the cream ale is spot on--also nice guest brews on tap--leg humper hefe is next best thing to a Franziskaner.  Lots of parking in the back--expect this place to do very well.  Simple menu, good value and cold beer!  Check it out--

Glad to see a small brewery open up in Scottsdale.  Food is great, beers are good if you like hoppy, the brewer seems to have a very heavy hop hand.  A couple taps dedicated to other local brews.  Very friendly staff.  Really glad to see this place open.

Disappointing...a long list of beers that they brew and only 3 were checked as available - what???

Nice patio, friendly service and the wood fired pizzas looked good too, but I couldn't get past the limited types of beer offered.
Great place and Nice staff will return flatbread was excellent

This brew pub still suffers the pains of a newly opened business. We came for a late dinner after the car auctions and found their beers a bit watery compared to Oak Creeks product, which we'd had earlier that day. Pizza is hand tossed northern italian style and while it has good ingredients, toppings were a bit hard to figure out when they arrived. room is VERY LOUD, lot s of hard surfaces.. hope these guys adjust a bit.. as they say "it's in their hands"

I recently paid a visit to a cousin in Arizona for his college graduation and decided to hit up a couple of breweries during my stay. While a good number of them were pretty underwhelming, Fate Brewing Company was the best one I went to.

Fate also happens to be a brewpub, meaning that they also make food in addition to brewing beer. While the large wood-fire pizza oven they had in the back made me tempted order a slice, I decided to stick to the beers and ordered myself a tasting flight.

And boy were they some good beers. While I won't bore you with a complete rundown of the beers I had I'll mention the two standouts: the Suburnt Sour and the Shea Connection.

The Sunburt was one of the better sour beers I have had. Unlike most other sour beers, the Suburt had other flavors you can taste besides the tartness. The Shea Connection was a collaboration brew Fate did with Scottsdale Beer Company and it had a great rye flavor with just a subtle hint of oak.

The tasting room/restaurant had a nice modern feel to it with ample seating. There are TVs on the wall where you can watch whatever sports game they have playing at the time and the service was attentive and friendly.

If you ever find yourself in Scottsdale, Arizona make sure to hit up Fate Brewing Company. You won't regret it.

Stopped in today to finally check out the digs....  I like how spacious the joint was.  Although there weren't a lot of us in there, it wasn't too loud, noise didn't carry!  Tony was the Beertender....friendly, chatty chap.  He brought up that they will have a new location April/May-ish...  Looking forward to checking that out since I'm in the EV, so Shea is a haul.  They were running low on EVERYTHING...so no growler fills...  Guess, just another reason to go back.  Thanks Fate!!

Easy to find, clean, friendly staff but most of all the beers I tasted were well crafted; hefeweizen, pale down unda, Irish red and stout. Well worth the stop. Some food available, wood fired pizza, did not eat though.

Overrated!

Pros: great beer.

Cons: Small menu and only a couple of good things on the menu. The pizza is good only half the time when it is cooked and they have a good chicken wrap. 

This place is strictly a small beer hall.

I love this place.  It has all of the necessities of life and nothing else.  
Each of their beers are excellent examples of their type, the pizza and salad are great.
It's small, simple and perfect.  
Home run!

Good beer and wood fired pizza, seems like a winning concept. 

I love micro brews, and this place has a great in house selection. In addtion they have a wine list and brick wood fired pizzas. 

The pizza was good, but the dough was a bit bland maybe a bit more water and salt could help this dough be lighter and have a bit more flavor.

My smoked porter was great, nice body, finish and a decent gravity too. 

The walls and floors are all hard surfaces so it can get a bit loud in here.

Tried this place for the first time on a Wed night. We had a large group so they reserved a few tables for us and extended their happy our until 8pm (ends at 6pm). Our group very much appreciated this generosity! 
I had the Mr. Pineapple beer as it seemed the lightest beer on the menu; they had I think 9 others on the Happy Hour menu. Crisp and refreshing beer. 
My husband and I shared one of the wood fired pepperoni pizzas; I think it was $12. The serving size was great for us to share... others might call this a super sized personal pizza. Maybe about 14". It was a good pizza; sauce had a nice spice to it. Ours was slightly over cooked but our friends Margarita pizza looked perfect. That's the risk with wood fired pizza's.
The wine selection wasn't all that great and overpriced compared to what I've paid at bars... they really had restaurant prices on the wine (a $12 bottle at Bevmo is $35 here). A friend ordered a bottle of red wine and it was way too warm... in AZ you really need to have all your wine in a cooler; the room temperatures here are just too hot for wine serving. So I'd pass on the wine here and stick with the beer - but hey, it's a brewery so beer is really the way to go.
Interior is industrial looking, I liked it. They have a medium sized patio out front and a garage door at the entrance they can open to bring the spaces together. 
We had really good service too. We will def. be back to this place... perhaps I'll try a beer flight next time.

The service was helpful and super friendly! Went there for happy hour with full intentions of grabbing food as well. That quickly changed about two beers into our shared flight! Glad we didn't get two since we could barely finish the first. All the beers were extremely strong and their stout was legitimately a candy bar taste. Wouldn't recommend it to anyone even though I never tried the food. Much better breweries in the area.
I was not impressed by this place at all. The beer selection was very limited and the menu was very minimal as well. I would not visit again.

The unique beer selection alone should be enough to lure anyone here.  I never thought a brewery could possibly unseat my all time decade long favorite Four Peaks, but this place certainly comes close.  Service can be a little hit or miss as I've had to go to the bar a few times to get myself a beer.  An issue I have NEVER encountered at Four Peaks in 15 years going there.  The pizza is really good, but the real reason to venture here is definitely the unique locally crafted beer selection.

Enjoyed our visit to Fate. We intended to stop in just to sample some beer, but ended up ordering some salads which turned out to be surprisingly good. Not sure why i was shocked, maybe i was just happy we were able to get a tasty vegan option, with a little substituting. 

I don't recall having a beer really stand out for me, seemed like they were all good, but the imperial ipa wasn't what i hoped it would be. By all, i think they only had 3 of theirs available. So not a whole lot of their own to sample, but he's just a little guy. 

Overall, the place has a good vibe going on and was worth checking out.

Beer was decent and pizza was pretty good. My only advice is to let the pizza sit for a minute as the topping tend to fall off when the pizza just comes out. I enjoyed the DIPA, which was good but didn't get a chance to try the brown.

A great chill place to sit out on the patio and enjoy the beverage of your choice and some pizza. I went here with a group of Yelpers as Fate Brewing was the payoff after hiking Pinnacle Peak on our Hike & Brew UYE.

First of all, the service was outstanding and individual checks were written without any fuss. It was gorgeous day outside for some conversation, drinks and food. I had the sausage pizza with goat cheese sans the mushrooms. That pizza was wall to wall sausage. I unfortunately negated the calories I burned hiking by eating that pizza but my tummy was very happy. The pizza tasted very good and was reasonably priced.

I might have to try some other items next time but to tell you the truth it would be hard to pass up on that pizza.

Well, my husband and I were on the hunt for a new brewery to check out.  He works across the street and had been mentioning we should try it.  We finally got a day off together this past Saturday and decided this was the day.  LOVE the atmosphere first off.  The wait staff we friendly and very attentive. I believe our waiter's name was AJ and he was very helpful and friendly.  We started out with a Lumberjack Rasberry (which was on a special draft) and their Hef.  Uh-Maz-Ing for both.  We also ordered a House Salad to split and a Mediterranean Pizza to split.  Again Uh-Maz-Ing!!  I ordered a couple more Hefs and the hubby ordered their IPA that was on draft and then a Hef to close out our tab.  We were sooooo impressed, we will be back later this week and have even been talking about having my 40th Birthday celebration there in a month!!  WELL WORTH IT AND CAN'T WAIT TO HAVE MORE GREAT TIMES HERE

Solid craft brewery.  $4 HH pints and nice selection of snacks plus a $13 daily pizza special.
