Don't really dig folks bringing big hairy dogs inside a place where food is served - but hey - it's pretty much a bar.  If your into micro-brews - this should be one of your regular happy hour watering holes...  I will be back.

I like trying new things. Its fun and hip. While killing some time before doing side work on a Sunday, I did a Yelp Search and *poof* Fate Brewing popped up. Lets review:

~Fud/Drink~
The food here is pretty urban and "gastropub-ish" if you ask me. I had the Scarlet Skillet Omelet (see pic) which was very good. Everything mixed together very well, even if it looks like something your cat yacked up....it was very good. I ordered a bloody beer (they actually name it that on the menu, score) with their light ale.  All their dishes look good, prices are a tad high but the quality is there. Of the crafts they brew, all but 1 was dark or very hoppy, which is why they lose a whole star. The variety simply was not there if you like anything relatively light or refreshing.

Even the ale they gave me was a Pale Ale which, I am not a fan of. It had the traditional PA hoppy kick. It tasted good with my bloody mix in it...but still, where is the variety? The guest beers were also all very hoppy or dark, so even if I jumped over to the guest list its difficult. I know its winter, but not every winter beer HAS to be dark... I am still getting used to dark beers, so I am totally up to trying new things... but give me variety!!!

~Atmosphere/Service~
This place has a hipster feel to it. A lot of ironic items throughout, like the tool bench drawer used to cart off used growlers or old drinks...or some of the chairs which are made out of random materials. The large stone bar-top is inviting and spacious, allowing for a lot of items to be strewn across. A comparable amount of tables are inside, as well as a short-but-sweet patio up front. Service was good, one barkeep for the lot of us at the bar on a Sunday is OK. He was helpful and gave me a couple samples to try. Nothing overwhelming in either direction...nice guy.  It definitely has an open, relaxing feel to it. Really relaxing and comforting place to head over to on a Sat-Sun morning, I feel. You won't look/feel like an alchy if you come in for a drink or two and get some brunch.

~The Down Low~
Good solid spot to unwind, upscale in some aspects, with an emphasis on hipsterism in some areas. Come on down, its a fun place to be as you can tell that a lot of beer enthusiasts come here. They get 4 stars for fun/refreshing set-up, good mix on menu, well made craft beers, and an inviting atmosphere.

Found this place on Yelp, thought we'd give it a try. Very small venue located in an unassuming strip mall. My initial thoughts were not promising. It was hot and crowded inside. When we finally received a menu, I knew right away what I wanted.  Cuppa Jose Milk Stout, amazing and definitely worth going back for. (Oh, and the AC kicked on eventually)
I love this place! My boyfriend and I go here at least once a week. They always have new beers. Their Table Saison and Imperial Coffee Stout is super yummy. Great pizza and nice service!

Small gem hidden in a strip center, community tables, first come first serve.  Menu is limited to pizza and a couple of salads and appetizers, but they were all good (had three different types of pizza with a group to share).  They are a micro brew and it was AZ beer week, so the "theme" that night was all their beers (other times they have their own plus other brands) we had several different ones. I had the cream ale and it was a good option for me since I am more of a wine and domestic beer drinker :) not too heavy and very smooth.  It was a cool vibe, laid back and not stuffy at all.  I would definitely go back.

Run how a microbrewery should be run! Equipment on display. Limited, but decent food (minus the Irish Nachos...), attentive wait staff, good service with the staff being unapologetic for unanticipated demand in beers leading to limited beer choices. And, most importantly, a welcoming place you could call home.

What more could you want?

Was it destiny that brought us to Fate? Or did Fate become our destiny?

McFate's specializes in wood-fired pizza and small batch beers with fun names like "Oh My Gatos!", "Totes McOats" and "Fate-Ality". Not a very large spot to hang out so expect the possibility of a little bit of a wait, but the servers were relatively attentive despite being ultra, mega, super busy. 

Personally, I'm a cider gal so I was happy to see that they offer Ciderboys Strawberry Magic in bottles. Which if you have never sampled before, Strawberry Magic smells like a daydream of skipping through fields of strawberries and sunshine (and tastes equally as wonderful)!!

We tried a pizza with half, Truff N Stuff - olive oil, mozzarella, red onion, arugula, shaved parmesan, and lemon truffle vinaigrette and half, The Jess - cheese, baby spinach, bacon, roasted garlic. While Truff N Stuff was good, The Jess was definitely the standout and full of flavor. Yum!

Really pleased with this visit and can't wait to try McFate's - South sometime as well!

Adding a bit of what else makes a venue special - it's the people and the service. Some of the staff that I've met include Fausto, Terry, A.J., Brandon, Travis, and Summer. Terry has moved on, but he was one great ex-dreadlocked barkeep. I think it was that he had to get married and get serious with life.
Fausto, Travis and Summer are great, they remember who you are, they check back with you regularly, and they remember what you like. 
It's the follow-through when you're delivering an order, whether it's a single customer or a gaggle, a single beer or a feast, it's important to meet the customers' eyes when the product is delivered. There's nothing worse than having the employee set the order down but be talking or concentrating on someone else at that moment. Without that moment of connection, the delivery seems like an afterthought. I've rarely had to be on the other side of the transaction, so all i can say is I appreciate the demands on the employee, but as a customer, that' moment of connection makes me believe that the server knows that I'm there.
The crowd gets bigger as the week moves on. Mondays and Tuesdays are quiet, even into Happy Hour. And by the way, the Happy Hour deals are good.
Fate's my neighborhood brewery, I appreciate the work of McFate and his team for their entrepreneurial and beer-making skills and passion!

They hit the nail on the head at Fate: the craft beer, artisan pizza, and chill atmosphere definitely make it an enjoyable place to go eat and hang out. I recommend the capicola pizza with the pale ale. Get a flight of 5 your first time, of course.

This is a pretty cool place, and one of two locations for this brewery. The beers here are well made, clean and free from off flavors. Service was friendly and attentive, I did not try the food!!
I had several samplers of the beer and I can honestly say I enjoyed them all!!
The place is small but cozy, the newer location on Scottsdale Road is much bigger!
This is a stop worth making if you're in the neighborhood.

Friendly  and inviting atmosphere. 
Fantastic beers. IPA'S are to die for. 
Killer pizzas.  The model works.

First time to Fate and it won't be my last! We came in for lunch knowing nothing about this place other than they make beer and pizza. Both were very good!  I started with the double IPA being it has a 100 IBU and a specific gravity of 8.5! Nice start! I ordered the Sunnyside pizza and was not disappointed in any fashion. The crust was thin and crispy all the way to the center. If you like the pies at Pane Bianco or Pizzeria Bianco you'll like these just as well (although the dough is not as salty). Also try some of the chili oil. I always like a little extra oil on my pizza and this was just what I like, a little extra flavor and a bump in heat. 
The menu isn't large, which is good, because it allows them to concentrate on what they do best. 
Very good overall including the service.

I have been waiting for Fate to open up, I had even tracked their progress a bit while they were in construction phase.

I am glad to say my first visit did not disappoint.

Beers:
Smoked Porter - interesting
Irish Red ale - tasty
Imperial IPA - yummy
American Brown ale - good

They only have one Appetizer which is the pizza sticks.  Basically cheese covered breadsticks with a side of marinara for dipping.  It was good.

Hubby ordered the Rustica pizza - garlic olive oil, artichoke hearts, roasted red bell pepper, capicola, gorgonzola cheese.  Since I am not a fan of gorgonzola cheese, I did not really eat it.  I did take a bite to see how well excuted the pizza was, and I must say I found it pretty good with a great crust.  Even though  I had enjoyed the couple bites of pizza, I stopped because the gorgonzola taste would eventually overwhelm me and then I would hate it.  But hubby loved it.

Cake pops were pretty good too.  Had the snickerdoodle and the red velvet. 

Service was friendly and efficient.

Solid place I will come back to.

Definitely enjoyed lunch here. Outdoor patio has lots of shady seating. We had the Jess Pizza on gf crust. Garlic oil with motzerella, spinach, bacon, roasted garlic, and ricotta. The crust was nice and crispy. The flavor was great and we enjoyed it.

The salads looked good and I heard they have great beer selection, although I'm not a beer drinker.

When guests are in town, we take them here for beer. The staff is always so friendly and they know how to brew a good cold one. Don't skimp out on the food, their pizzas and bar bites are top notch. I wouldn't change a thing about this brewery.

Their American Pale Ale is one of my favorites, on the order of Sierra Nevada if you like that. They also have a good selection of guest taps as well which rotate regularly. 

Their pizzas are good and their salads generously portioned. So are the pretzels, but I don't often get them cause they are really filling. 

The service here is excellent. There can be a longer wait for a table on busy nights as there are a limited number of seats here in this location.

As the Duchess of McFate I am honored to review them & give them 5 stars! I obviously frequent this gem spot often, making it one of my go to spots for great food, great brews & great atmosphere. I'm never disappointed. Travis & Tony are exceptional employees with an over achieving attitude. We are always greeted with a smile and a warm welcome. As far as some of my favorite brews & bites, here they are (in no particular order) Oh my Gators (brew) Candy Bar Milk Stout (seasonal brew) Green Flash (guest beer) The Jess (pizza) The Con Carne (pizza) Twists of Fate (app) The McFatta Platta (app) & the Caprese Salad. They have a rotating food menu as well as a rotating brew selection, so you are always able to try something new.  My tastebuds crave their delightful dishes as least once a week. If you have never been here, you're seriously missing out! It's worth the commute if you don't live local. They also have a location in Old Town Scottsdale. Give them a shot! I promise you won't be disappointed!!!
Great craft beer selection. Order pretzel, mustard is outstanding as well as the pretzel. Unique beers like Mexican hot chocolate, horchata and candy bat stouts. All very good.
Great experience... Beers a little too hoppy for my taste, but fun times and yummy pretzel!!

What a great find. Had 2 different microbrews-one with a hint of banana & the other a lighter shift ale that was super flavorful. Then had great Irish Nachos which were made with thinly sliced potatoes. Also had pretzels with cheese and spicy mustard. Pizza was great. We had staff special Hoagie pizza & fennel sausage with mushroom. All of it was awesome! Wait staff was great. They all work together so we really didn't have to wait for or flag down a server. Would definitely return. Fabulous.

Beer was good, but not over the top memorable. New place had high ceilings that just echoed all the noise of the place.
Good joint, but really loud with some obnoxious college girls talking loud on their phones.  The bartender was more interested in flirting with them than giving good service to people that actually tip for good service.....

(Lyrics - George Michael - Faith)

Well I guess it would be nice
If I could taste your craft beer
I know not everybody 
has got a brewery like yours

But I've got to sip twice
Before I give my heart away
And I know all the games you will play 
Because it's on Direc TV Too!

Time to pick my fork up off the plate

With that aroma

Fate is a local brewing company located in Scottsdale.  There used to be life around here back in the days when Devil's Martini existed.  Still some small hot spots here and there; the there is Fate.  The only beer brewing restaurant around; this cute little brewery spices up the night life back into the area.

I shared the olive side and a capicola pizza with a pal.  If you like olives this was a delight.  Nicely dripping in it's own juice with a salty punch to your palates.  The firewood pizza that we ordered was okay I thought.  The crust got dried out quickly and the toppings did the same.  Kept on drinking to finish it off!  

Drinking was not what I did here though.  I'm not a big fan of craft beers, but can appreciate it.  We sampled all their beers and my favorite and also strongest was the Belgo American Tripel.  Strong indeed cause I started to buzz a little after one!  Light weight here!  Anyways, the other beer were strong also and extra bitter to me.  Almost like an IPA which I despise!  All you IPA drinkers can hate...go ahead.  

Overall, the atmosphere is great and the service was awesome.  Drinks were fine, but not my cup of tea and the food was okay. - Enjoy!

I've been here a few times recently and have been very impressed with what McFate has to offer. The beer is obviously the main attraction and I'm a huge (yuuuuge) fan of their Fateful IPA (6.6% ABV 85 IBU) and their Hibiscus Pale (5.4% ABV 40 IBU). The bar staff is always more than willing to help you choose something perfect for you and even recommends mixing certain beers to create something magical! 

I've had a few of their pizzas, but the best is by far the Sticky Fingers with garlic oil, mozzarella, Serrano ham, arugula, and habanero honey drizzle. The habanero is just spicy enough without being overwhelming and the honey provides the sweet balance. Service has always been fast and friendly. I'll continue to come back!

I am not much of beer drinker but I had a lot of them here on Sunday morning for breakfast. Hahaha, I know! I justified myself by adding orange juice first.

First one I ordered was beermosa. Pick light beer and orange juice. It tasted more like fuzzy orange juice. 

If you order breakfast pizza (they add egg to pizza and call it breakfast pizza), two 5 oz beer is included. I picked two of the last one on the list. Stout and Irish something. Both of them were very good, quite tasty, I learned I prefer dark beer. (Just to note, I didn't drive several hours after drinking).

Nice little brewery here with good service and good beer. We will be back again.

Pizza tastes great. The beer however, is extremely bitter, no matter which kind you get. I got a sampler flight of all the beers and couldn't choke down one of any of the samplers. I'm a Stella/Kiltlifter kind of guy, and this beer is definitely not my taste. 

I thought the homemade root beer had to bring some redemption. Wrong again. It was flat. 

Service and atmosphere are good, prices are expeeensive for what you get. Probably not going to return. I can see why some folks like it but it's not for everyone.

After reading so many great reviews I was glad to finally make it up here. This place a a small, smart, cheerful no-nonsense place for beer lovers to come enjoy some craft beer. I can't comment on the food because I was on a strict liquid bread diet when I came in. But their wood-fired pizzas look good....next time.

I ordered a flight that kept my occupied for a while. I think my favorite was the American Pale Ale, believe it or not. but I also really enjoyed their Irish Red. I also followed this by the Grand Canyon Pils which I thoroughly enjoyed as well.

They have a nice bar area and the servers are great. You can really tell that they are beer enthusiasts themselves and that makes the experience enjoyable. I recommend this place highly if you want to have a beer or two in a friendly, relaxed environment.

Perhaps the best beer in town. Loved this place before they opened the new on, so I'm super happy they're doing well. Quality food and drinks, but a pretty laid back atmosphere. Not wild like four peaks, with a pretty clean an classy ambiance. Still small enough of an operation to know most of the servers by name, and the beer is always solid. Go for the pizzas. They're bistro quality. Love the Pablo Honey and the Jess. 

Simple. Classy. Solid. This place needs to be found more often.

Atmo?  Comfy; neighborhood-y.

Beer?  Tasty.  I had the stout.  

Pizza?  Horrible, horrible, horrible.  A waste of a good wood for the joint's  wood-fired oven. The crust had absolutely no flavor.  Devoid of salt.  No carbon burn from the oven. Flatter than the desert's floor.  No bubbles in the crust.  My pizza came with a sunnyside egg.  The egg was sunnyside decimated and the white was runny.  

And with this review I do solemnly swear that I will never finish a restaurant meal if it is not good.  If the first bite is terrible, back it goes to the kitchen.

I walked in about 6 PM on Friday and this place was packed.  I found a seat at the end of the bar near the TV and I was good to go.

I started out with their Irish Red beer.  It tasted very good and I liked it a little better than the cream ale that I had later.

I ordered the capicola pizza and it was very spicy and flavorful.  I'm not 100% sure I totally like the crust but overall I enjoyed my meal.

It looks like Fate will be a success!
One of my favorite breweries in AZ! Steve and his staff are so friendly and they allow dogs on the patio. I love their belgians, ales and IPAs.

I kind of found the place a bit on the dull side, but it was in Scottsdale, so probably par for the course. Speaking of courses, you can't throw a water scarcity without hitting 2 in these parts.

But I had a flight and the beers were good.
OK beer, but not as good as many other local breweries. Pizza was mediocre so if you go there spend the money on beer, not food.
Yummy food, great beer selection! We ate outside next to heat lamps and corn hole. Everyone loved their food. The restaurant and outdoor area are very spacious! The waitress was great to us!

This was my first time visiting this brewery and it was very enjoyable.  We got a table out on the patio and enjoyed the warm air and the nice view of Shea!  I ordered a sour and it was delicious, the perfect beer to sip, while enjoying the fresh baked pizza.  The servers were very friendly and more than accommodating.  We will definitely be back again in the near future.

The bartender was prompt but not friendly, he seemed a bit pretentious. The ipa was surprisingly good and my sister enjoyed the food I brought her from the restaurant. I'll be back since her salon is right next door , but it won't be for the sparkling service or conversation.
Single hop sour- the next hot beer for people looking for a change from IPA!  Hatch chili cream is also amazing.

First time eating here. It's small and intimate. We had the cheese sticks and pizza. Both were good, but the pizza was a little salty for my taste. I added some marinara from the cheese sticks which fixed the pizza right on up. I would go back if it wasn't so far out. I live on the West Side of town.

Don't let the roadside appearance fool you. This is a very Worthy Brew Pub to stop at. The beer choices are excellent in the food is way above average. We stopped here in January while on a conference trip. The place was so good we went back a second night that week rather than trying out another Brewery.

My family loved Fate Brewing Company!

We went to Fate for dinner expecting good beer. We got that plus a whole lot more.

As an appetizer we started with the pizza bread. It was a great start to our meal with some red sause and spicy oil to dip it in. Good for both kiids and parents.

My daughters are picky eaters but loved their in house brewed root beer and the pizza (pepperoni and  a rosemary roasted potato). They finished it off with a cake pop. Perfect.

As far as mom and dad - we enjoyed a sampler of five beers. My wife loved the cream ale and the pale ale. I thought the red and double IPA were great as well.  The smoke porter was a pleasant surprise to me. I am not a dark beer drinker but loved the taste of this beer. I can totally see drinking this along side of something lighter next time I go.

As far as food - I had the Molto Carne (pepperoni and sausage).  It had a little spice which I really liked. My wife had a salad with chicken on it. She said the meat had flavor and said she'd eat it again.

The staff was attentive and friendly.  They were knowledgable about the menu and the beer selection. I wasn't at the bar, but the bartenders seemed to have good rapport with their customers.

Bottom line - me and my family will be back to Fate.  If you like good beer, good food, and friendly people - you won't be disappointed.

Fate is great for microbrews and brick-oven pizza.  All of the pizzas that I've tried (vegetarian) have been pretty great.  The olive appetizer is also nice.  Lots of microbrews on tap as well as some local brews.  No wait (at least not so far), so that is a plus during the cool months.  I'm hoping this can remain a somewhat unknown neighborhood joint!

It was my 2nd time back at Fate's, 1st time I really didn't have anything but a glass of water, being DD and all, so I didn't think it warranted a review. 

This time I was with a group of friends, we met up for a Hike and Brew, and Fate Brewing was the placed picked for the brew part of the day.

Our server was Fausto, he was great! Told him I had to be the party pooper of the group and order fast & leave soon, but he didn't miss a beat, took my order and got me my drink! 

Still being new to ordering beers (the number of beers I have drank in my lifetime can be counted on one hand) I checked out the list of beers and went with the Irish Red,  it's a cooper red malted focused with an initial caramel sweetness & roasted dryness in the finish. Now the way I happened upon my 1st beer, which was a stout, someone said they are like coffee, I like coffee, ok I love coffee, so it has to be good right? So this Irish Red said caramel sweetness, yes I like that too, so that's how I picked Irish Red, and I have to say I was pretty happy with my choice. Very good, can't wait to try it again!

I was a little bit hungry, but not enough for an meal, so I ordered off the starter menu and got the Potato Nachos, now in the past when I have ordered potato nachos I always regret doing it because I like thick slices of potatoes covered in cheese and goodness not the paper thin slices, I'm a potato luv fool!  But this time I was not disappointed, it was potato slices, but not thin, but not too thick just perfectly right, covered in mozzarella cheese, topped with BACON, red onions, roasted garlic sour cream & chives. This plate of nachos was out of sight! Before I knew it, I ate it all! So dang good!

Glad to have made it back to Fate's and actually tried some beer & food this time :) Look forward to coming back!

Great service starting with hostess and manager.  The pale ale was awesome. Reminds me of Mirror Pond.

Pizzas are very good.

I went to Fate for the first time yesterday. My wife and I had a sampler of five beers, which were not bad at all. However it was the service that really made me lower this rating. 

For example, one of the servers pulled up a bar stool and sat on it for an extended amount of time, talking to her boyfriend, the bar tender, while encroaching on my wife's personal space. 

In addition, the bar tender gave very little attention to my wife and I and wasn't even looking at us when we ordered a margarita pizza (which was ok tasting). 

The business was busy when we went, but with service like we received, it won't stay that way forever.
Love this place!! nice vibe, great food, delicious beer, and AJ IS AWESOME!!!!

Although my hubby would award it 2.25 stars, I am not as harsh.  I loved my Belgian wit.  It was like Four peaks peach ale minus the peach.  Very refreshing!  We got potato nachos and they were different because they were cooked in their brick pizza oven, but we weren't huge fans.

Well I gotta say I'm disappointed I didn't try this place sooner. Small menu but the main dish served which is pizza was great. Now we only tried one but assuming how good this one was I can only imagine the rest are swell. As far as the beers, well I tried three different ones. The irish red, American brown ale and double oatmeal ipa which were all amazing. Clear looking and very smooth tasting.
great place, great beer!  I would recommend the potato Nachos.  Great food great service.  yum

Great addition to the neighborhood! My husband and I ate here about a week ago.  The inside is a perfect mix of rustic and contemporary decor.  The staff was great,  the beers were awesome, the food fresh, and the cake pops amazing. We also chatted with the owner for a bit - he is very committed, knowledgeable and personable.  I hope Fate is around for a long time to come.
Wow. This is the best milk stout I've ever tasted. Definitely coming back. Pizza was good too.

Double Oatmeal IPA was delicious, and the Red was really great too. There were lots of selections on tap, the atmosphere was great to surround yourself with friends, and the pies were reasonably priced, and delicious. I had the pablo honey- and it was outstanding. The wait staff seemed a bit overwhelmed, but handled it well. Overall, a good experience, good service, and good food.

We checked Yelp driving down from Las Vegas and found Fate.  Was it fate?  We were impressed by prior reviews so took the leap, and are pleased we did!  Fausto, our server, was a delight - attentive, knowledgeable and prompt in every way.  We enjoyed our meal - the margherita pizza was excellent with shredded basil over the entire surface, and the Red Irish Ale was a delight.  The unexpected bonus was their guest brew from Funkwerks in Fort Collins, CO, which was their King Tropic brew.  We had this at Funkwerks taproom in July, 2013, and it was superb, 8.2 ABV, and full of flavor.  It is worth the trip just for this beer alone, but that discounts Fate's Oatmeal Stout - a grand stout full of flavor and delicious from start to finish.  This is a new micro-brewery celebrating their one year anniversary.  Join them and enjoy every bite and every brew!
Came on the 19th of March, best pizza yet and we've been here dozens of times!
Great beer selection and the pizza is delicious. We ordered four different pizzas for group of 7 guys & had two pieces left over!  All 4 were very tasty!  Casual but nice environment
Had the Truff n Stuff pizza, it was honestly the best pizza I have ever ate. Washed it down with a Buffet Brown, that was one great beer... so I had another.  Will definitely keep coming back.
Excellent pizza, esp. For Sunday brunch, and GREAT beer. The place is comfy, with a great patio. The glow of the pizza oven radiates ambiance, even in the heat of summer.
Love this little place in Scottsdale!  Fantastic pizza!  Good people.  Servers know their stuff!!
Enjoyed the Irish Red and the pale ale. Pizza was good and the potato nachos were VERY good!

Great bar, with excellent service! Didn't get five feet in the door and was greeted with a smile. I sat down at the bar and had instant service, I ordered the coffee milk stout and would recommend to anyone who enjoys a dark beer.

Just a short walk from our hotel this gem was a sweet find on Yelp! The friendly & fast service was outdone only by the delicious craft beer selection and fantastic wood-fired pizza! Go, you'll love it too.

Went here for the first time a few weeks ago. Let me say for being a smaller brewery/restaurant they are doing it so right. There was not a beer that I had there which I did not like. In fact I loved the ones I had. They were so unique and different.  Also their pizzas are bursting with flavor and fresh ingredients. They also have a secret oil sauce that you can put on your pizza or anything you order that kicks up the flavor. Great place I am already planning a return trip.

OMG this place is the bomb.com! I had a couple friends who used to work there recommend it to me and if I could go back every day to eat their food and drink their yummy beer (without becoming an alcoholic haha), I would! 

Ordered the Oatmeal Crisp which was perfect for the time of year. Light and crisp (as the name suggests). For food, we got the Sow Sweet...... this is TO DIE FOR.  It's a white sauce pizza with prosciutto, fig jam, apples and goat cheese - holy mouth watering goodness! I was so full but I wanted to eat more and then order another to go (sadly I did not). 

The staff there was very helpful and never overbearing. The space is smaller but I don't mind that. There's plenty of seating for bigger groups as well even though the space may not be as big as some of the big box restaurants. 

Love love love this place!

This is my favorite Arizona Brewery by far.  As far as this location the staff is great, friendly, helpful, FUNNY and just plain the best!   One of my favorite things is it's always CLEAN.  I am a bit of a germ-a-phob and if there are signs like unclean dishes, dirty tables and floors or bathrooms - you won't see me back for a second visit.   And I've been here a gabillion times.   The pizzas are amazing; my favorite is the Peggyrita with pepperoni - trying to get it added to the menu as The PeppiRita ;-) I love McFate!!!!
Delicious and creative pizzas with awesome beer! If I was a local I would definitely come back and often!

I've been to Fate more than a handful of times and have always had a great experience.  Even though their newer, larger location is closer to where I currently live, I always take the longer trip to this one.  

Employees are friendly and the service is excellent.  I love the Pablo Honey pizza.  Beers are always refreshing and they typically have something new to offer each time I drop by.  

Also, the habanero oil that they have for your pizza is amazing.  I love the added kick it gives my pizza as my boyfriend who usually tags along is not a fan of spicy.
Great selection of brews, yummy pizza, and awesome staff!

One of the best microbrewery in AZ. Wood fired pizzas are amazing and the beer is by far one of the best out there. Steve the owner and Adam the head brewer are always friendly and serve up great beers and food. If you have not been here, you are missing out!

High end brewpub with great decor, great beer, great food, great service

Went here twice in one day it was so good and had to bring my family here. Modern, wood decor. Beers ranged from good to ridiculous with some beers being the best I'd had all month. Sours, Berliners, ancho chili stouts, pilsner crisp like APAs. House beers dominate the tight tap list, only one guest tap. Sampler flights allowed at 5 at a time served in mini flute and well organized. Food is pretty much all pizza, but what we had was very good. Service was friendly and check up on us quite a bit. Outdoor patio with heat lamps is a plus. Overall, my favorite place so far in the Phoenix area and will be back!

Came in for the anniversary party so I wasn't able to actually take a seat and grab some food - it was way over capacity. I tried a vanilla cocoa smoked porter and it was very heavy and over the top on the smoke flavour. I'm more of a fruit-infused beer drinker, though, and there wasn't anything on the brew menu that catered to that. I would come back on a normal business day to try the pizza or some of the lighter beers, but a brewery with such a small variety of beers and no beer-based foods is not what I'm usually looking for in a brewery - but if you're into trying new beers, definitely check them out. They had some unique flavours!

As a beer fan, Ive wanted to try this place since it opened.

Even though this place was the backup we didn't end up needing, I seized the opportunity to try it anyway. We were seated immediately and both our servers were attentive an pleasant. This place is gorgeous. Lots of different woods, a beautiful bar, and a view into their brewing room from all parts of the restaurant.

Myself and 2 of my fellow Yelpers opted for the flight +1 (all 6 of their brews featured at the time). My faves includes their Irish red (which I'm not usually a fan of), their American pale ale, and the Saison. Nice, refreshing and crisp. I was not a fan of their hefe, really not. There was a note of something I can not put my finger on that did not agree w/ my taste buds.

If you're a craft beer fan, I'd definitely recommend stopping in for a pint or flight.
Love that they are dog friendly on the patio - they were even kind enough to bring out water dishes for our dogs. Great beer and excellent pizza is hard to beat!

As a Craft Beer junky I was not overly impressed with the beer. I guess I can thank my West Coast IPA pallette for that. I will give 2 thumbs up to Porter. Big beer but very easy to drink with a great finish...I was impressed!

The food - had Reuben with tater tots and fries - SOLID!

Service - Antonio (Anthony) was spot on - allowed us to take our time and was knowledgeable around the beer menu (a plus coming from a beer snob)

My hopes is Fate brews a more traditional West Coast DIPA in the near future as I am in Scottsdale all the time for work and will be coming back soon

I absolutely love this place! I've been there several times and tried many beers, as they're always rotating. Everything is great (the Chili Milk Stout and the Strawberry Rhubarb have been my favorites). The food is also delicious; they recently changed their menu to include more than pizza. It can be a little pricy, but it's a great date spot.

Found these guys on yelp last night and after reading the great reviews and seeing the great looking food thought we would give them a try. Saw on yelp and later their website they were open till 11pm, Saturday's. We got their at 10pm and saw what appeared to be three employees talking behind the bar. There were two customers at the bar and two more seated in the restaurant area. Although the employees looked at us walk in, no one acknowledged our existence. The three of us sat down at a table thinking someone would come give us menus and take drink orders. No one bothered coming over to us or greeting us. After approximately 5-10 minutes we left without ever talking to an employee. They may have decent beer, decent food, but their service is unacceptable and if continues I'd assume even in Scottsdale they'll die off because people have better service options serving similar fare.

We went a couple miles west to OHSO Brewery had a great time.

Fate, IMHO, is the best brewery in Arizona, and currently my favorite restaurant in Phoenix. What continuously excites and surprises me is not just the quality if the beer, but the consistency in excellence. I have been here quite a few (10+) times and have never walked away disappointed. Their beer is always delicious and their descriptions are always spot on. I would recommend a few beers, but chances are they will not be on tap when you are there as they are constantly rotating. The food is the same, excellent and consistent. The Jess and Pablo Honey are my personal favorite pizzas, but am regularly impressed with the rotating special pizzas. The atmosphere is good, if a bit simple. I like that you can see the brewing area but that it is separated by glass. I dig that the taps are skateboard trucks as well. The staff have always been courteous and knowledgeable about brews. CHECK THIS PLACE OUT!

Fantastic local brewery! Delicious brews and tasty pizza! I consider myself to be a foodie and beer snob and this place is definitely worth checking out. Their Red was really good. Get the beer flight to try all if their beers and then determine your own favorite!

Went on a Sunday afternoon at 1:30. Ashlee was our server and it was fun to visit with her. She knew her beers, is a hop head, and directed me to the Double Oatmeal IPA which was amazing. They had a good brunch menu; I had the classic breakfast pizza and my wife had the bacon and mushroom frittata skillet.

As we waited for our food and I enjoyed the Double Oatmeal IPA, Ashlee brought over samples of the other Fate brews saying she enjoyed talking to craft brew fans and wanted us to taste their other beers as well. I tend toward IPAs and the pale ale was excellent but I was surprised by the red, absent the over-sweet maltiness I've tasted in a lot of microbrews of that style. It was dark but not heavy, with just enough hop to balance the malt or rye. I ended up taking home a growler of the red though I'd planned on a growler of the Pale Ale, both for the variety and because it was so good. Truth be told, I also took home a "growlerette" of the Double Oatmeal IPA. The "growlerette" was a cool small growler with a flip top that would be reused and enjoyed by home brewers, and is just cool looking.

Matching the beer, the food was very good. My classic breakfast pizza had olive oil, bacon, rosemary roasted potatoes, mozzarella, cracked egg and was finished with fresh herb. It was a nine inch pizza with a crisp crust. The egg, cheese, and potatoes matched well and contrasted with the crunch of the crust. My wife's frittata was also very good and she commented more than once on the flavor of the rosemary roasted potatoes coming through. Hers was served in a small cast iron skillet on a board with pegs holding it in place. The server who brought the food to our table noted our choices and said we were in for a treat. He was right. Ashlee came by and noticed I'd not eaten the crust of the pizza and she suggested trying the pepper oil on the table with the crust. I turned out I cleaned the plate with the pepper oil and crust.

Service, food, and beer were all top notch. In our family we have a tradition of choosing a restaurant for our birthdays and, for the last few years, my choice has been either Four Peaks in Tempe or San Tan Brewery in Chandler. While I still love both of those breweries, Fate will be where I draw my family from across the valley for my next birthday.

Don't miss this place!

The pizza was fantastic.  We tried the margherita and the pepperoni, both of which we loved!  Between us, we tried all their current beers on tap.  My Mom loved the Irish Red, Dad loved the Belgo, and I had a Fate Imperial IPA and a Black IPA, both of which were fantastic.  Especially dug the Black IPA, love to see those!  Our server Steven was so nice and helpful and the manager, Ben, was wonderful as well.  This is a great place to drop in and have a beer, love that you can see the brewing equipment as well as the kitchen, it really adds to the awesome atmosphere!

My friend and I initially came for Dirty Dogg Saloon, but there was an event so we decided to go to McFate; this place has been on my list for awhile now, so I suppose it was meant to be. We started off with two nitro beers, both were amazing, but I cannot remember the names and it's not on their website. 

I was starving so I ordered the Roasted Grape salad and the Sticky Fingers pizza due to the delicious habanero honey. I ended up ordering a side of it because it was so damn good! And yes, I did have sticky fingers and no, they do not have wet wipes.  Let me tell yah, it was so hard for me to hold myself back, I only ate 3 slices, but I wanted to eat the whole pizza! Gotta watch my figure though. ;) 
With regard to the roasted grape salad, it was fantastic, but next time I will be asking for the dressing on the side as it came mixed in. 

The customer service was excellent - the bartender we had was knowledgeable and hilarious. He recommended I should order the buffalo chicken wrap with habanero honey next time I am in, so I will probably do that next week. 

All in all, this place was fantastic and I cannot wait to go back!

Nice evening tried a few beers and the pretzel app.    Great beers and atmosphere.    Sat at the bar and learned a great deal about the beers and how they make them.   Met some great people that shared other places with us we should try in the neighborhood.   Service was great and everyone made for a nice evening.
Went here and tried the Irish Red that they brew.....Not bad but I have had better. The pizza here though is unbelievable.

Updating my review; 
Fate Brewing didn't blow me away on my first visit, just happened that most of their beers were big and strong. But, I gave them a few more tries and they totally won me over. I've stopped in about a dozen times now and it's becoming one of my favorite breweries to go to. On my first visit, the beers didn't do much for me, but the nice thing is that they are always coming up with new and better brews all the time. The last few times I've come in, they have had some really great pale ales, IPAs and they seem to specialize in stouts as they are some of the few I drink. The food is also amazing; they have wood-fired pizzas that are all terrific and delicious. Also, their happy hour small bites make it a go-to happy hour spot for me. The staff is also very cool, very friendly and happy to let you know about the brews going on and what to expect. So I recommend Fate for happy hour and dinner for a pizza a beer; what could be better?

Not bad, good ambience for a brewery. It was relevant enough for guys to go grab some beers there and also for young families to come by.

I need to come here more /try more of their beers to give you my opinion.

They have some other beers on tap...orange shanty is nasty...but you all knew that already.

Go for their beers instead
Pretty good, no complaints. We tried the coffee stout which was great and the IPA was okay.  I just wasn't really blown away by the place, but would go back.

A must !! I have been to all the breweries in Arizona  , and this is the best!!  Arizona is trying to find a beer identify  and these guys here at fate will set the mark!!!

Always great beer
Walked over from the Hampton Inn for a beer and light dinner. We had some great beer, salad and pizza. Was a little noisy but definitely a fun place. Service was also great.

Come here quite a bit ... Short n sweet; small spot, great food, friendly staff (shout out to my boy Tony one of the bartenders), chill spot but surprisingly I'm not crazy about a lot of the handles. The taps rotate regularly but after all the times I've been I haven't found a draft that I've been crazy about .. The pretzels n pizza are must try. Just saying!

Love this place! Misty was our amazing bartender. We also found out she was the one that invented the pizza special the evening we went there. So good! We look forward to returning to the fabulous hospitality and a great selection of ice cold beer.

Decent happy hour menu -- only minimal savings off regular priced menu items, but fine. Food is ok. Beer is tasty. Service is meh. Fine if you don't have any questions about the menu, etc. Nice guy but much more interested in talking about anything other than the food or beer. Very nice. But I did come for the food and beer. 

Would I come back? Maybe. There's probably better but it definitely wasn't bad. Just meh. So if you're looking for a meh experience with decent beer and a similar happy hour menu, check it out.

I try not to give a lot of 5 star reviews but this is one of my favorite places for pizza, beer and their even salads. Service is awesome If you go their more than a couple of times the serves will probably know your name and what beer you drink. For beer drinkers the bartenders are aways happy to pore you a sample their beer to help you find your favorite.  Their beer is one of the best in the state and my favorite.  If they have the Nelson Shmelson they rarely do you have to try.  They did expand the menu from the south location still working out a few kinks but good.

Great new craft brewery offering a rotating tap, wood fired pizzas.   Great wide variety of pizzas including a rosemary potato; red peppers and goat cheese; you name it. The day I was there, they had 3 beers on tap including a delicious IPA. I'm curious to have the Saison and Cream ale when they next appear.  Excellent patio as well.

Had the beer flight and the Irish red. Nothing really jumps out as great but the Imperial Milk Porter (rum barrel aged). Need to have one of those. 

Atmosphere was great. Service was great. Pretty funny waiter. Not sure of his name but he had a beard. Great guy. Don't know if I would come back but would definitely have the Imperial Milk Porter again if in the area. Did not try any food.

This place used to have amazing Shroomin pesto pizza. I called from next door in the hair salon to have it delivered which they've done before. I got Mike on the phone. He was kind of a dick about it. He said they were too busy. I walked out of the salon and looked next door since my business at the salon was done, they aren't that busy. Just lazy fucks. Plus, they no longer have that pizza as they apparently changed their menu a month ago. New flash to the people who run this joint, CHANGE YOUR MENU ONLINE!!! Not ever going to this place again for anything.
There are alot of new Breweries but FATE rules. Steve Mcfate has great beer, people and atmosphere.

I love this place!' The staff is friendly and super helpful with the beer selection. We have tried several of their beers and my favorite is hatch chili. It has a hint of jalapeño and like no other beer. 

Pizza is thinner crust and not to heavy on the sauce. We also love beer cheese and pretzels as an app!
Great place to try for beer and pizza!
Tried to go on Monday at 8pm and they are closed......... It says 10pm on Mondays, and 9pm on Yelp! What's going on????

I LOVE Fate! 
They have the best pizzas. Who doesn't love a wood fired crust? 
My favorite appetizer is called 'Breads and Spreads'. It is always something different for the spread, last time it was jalepeno jelly and cream cheese. Then for the "bread" they give you pita bread and baguette bread. (It is served each time with three different spreads). So delicious. 
The food/beer is delicious. I love the atmosphere, service and the bathrooms are always clean!

Ok I say this every time, but I do not like to make a habit of giving a place 5 stars in my first try, but at Fate I can't help myself. Everything from the ambiance, food, happy hour, beer, and even cake pops were simply amazing!!,

I'll start with my favorite, beer. We got here early during happy hour and thought that my wife and I would order 2 beers each. So I ordered the Smoked Porter and she had Imperial IPA. Trying these I would say the imperial IPA was really good. 8.5 100lbu. Very tasty! The smoked porter was great too. Not really my thing but with food it tasted good. A little on the over smoked flavor but I respect that. After we had the pale ale and Irish Red. The pale ale was 6.0 and it was more on par of average IPA.  The Irish Red was amazing! A strong but refreshing red. This was my wife's favorite beer. Mine has to be the imperial IPA. 

During HH we ordered the pizza bread very good. Basically cheese bread on their pizza dough. It came with a side of marinara. I would total order it again next time we are at HH

We then decided to order a pizza to share. We chose the rustic pizza which including artichoke hearts, fennel,sausage, gorgonzola cheese. I thought it was excellent pizza! Even better with a craft beer next to you. 

Anyways our experience at Fate was excellent. Id like to add that the service was excellent and liked the layout of the restaurant and the small brew tanks. This place is small but seems like a lot of room at the bar and a decent sized patio.  

Oh one more thing, when we were walking out, my wife spotted the cake pop display. We had to turn around and ordered 2! 2 bucks each and well worth it!! We tried the sinker doodle and peppermint red velvet. The red velvet was the best! A little harder shell but once you ate more they were very moist. Do your self a favor and order at least one on your way out!!

Dear McFate,

I love you. I live out of state but was born and raised in Scottsdale. My brother and his family are always raving about you. I just so happened to be in town and thought, why not?! Let's see what all this hype is about. Beer: fantastic, so many options. I also love that you have other local brews available. Pretzel with beer cheese: fantastic. Con Carne pizza: favorite! I used to live in Colorado so my husband and I are big on the whole local brewery thing. Can't wait to go back on my next visit in town. So good!!! Also I bought a gift card for my brother- this isn't necessarily a bad thing but I was told they only work at the location they are bought at. It's not a problem because my brother and his family always go to this one but I thought it was odd, but the server did tell us which was nice. Love you guys. I highly recommend to anyone. 

Ps. $5 for a beer- great deal

Love this place! My friends brought me here for the first time a couple of weeks ago. The Oh My Gatos Golden Ale was delicious. For dinner, we ordered the McFate's salad and the The Jess and Con Carne pizzas. Everything was delicious, but my favorite was The Jess pizza. It was the perfect combination of ingredients! 

I would love to come back, sit on the patio and try some of the there beers and pizzas. I recommend this place!
Warm and welcoming brewpub!  The beers were good, a nice selection with something for everyone.  Nitro stout was excellent, creamy and full rich taste.  We enjoyed a wood fired pizza too, yum!

This is a great little hangout for a beer and some good pizza! Love the habanero infused olive oil they give you with the pizza. 
My only complaint is that occasionally I really want a "guest beer" and those beers are $1more. But, I understand the reason for that- so I am still giving 5 stars. Friendly, efficient staff at all times. Everyone should stop in and give this place a try. :-)

A great little craft brew joint. The Pale Ales are spot on and the wife enjoyed the Extra stout. The pretzels are pretty much poetry twisted into luscious goodness with awesome beer cheese dipping sauce.

You could tell there was a strong local following and the staff seemed to know most of them. That's what you look for when passing through. When you find it, you know you found a gem.

In one of those ridiculous desert rainstorms, we walked/ran down the block from our hotel to Fate, where we whiled away the rest of the storm drinking tasty beer and eating pizza bread.

The presentation of the beer menu is a tease here, as they list off all the beers they brew, leaving you salivating, before you realize that only three of them are currently available.  On our visit, two were IPAs, which seemed redundant with such a small selection.  Then I realized they had a couple of other beers which were not on the menu (5 or 6 total, plus some "guest" beers from other breweries) and I felt less confined.  All the beers we had were very good, and not weak.  They give you stats (alcohol content, IBUs, etc) to help you pick.  I could see coming back every so often just to check out what's new on tap.

We also had pizza bread, which was basically a medium cheese pizza.  It was exactly what the mid-afternoon happy hour called for.  Speaking of happy hour, we had four beers and that pizza for $18, which is kind of a ridiculous deal.  

I love checking out local breweries when I'm visiting a city, and this place exemplifies why.
Beer was good not great. Service was good. Food was reallllly good. Ambience was great for an Arizona brewery especially when compared to other startups.

Awesome spot.
So busy on a Friday happy hour but it was perfect. Wanted to try the gate beers but the kinds were ones I do not normally like. Tried a few , good.
The brown was great. Inside is sweet and the food looked good

The beer is done in small batches and makes for a great rotation. If you are a fan of craft beer, you are doing a disservice to yourself if you have not checked this place out.

The only complaint - A more robust kitchen would put this pace over the top.

The owner and staff have always been friendly and responsive.

Right now they have a double oatmeal IPA that is extremely smooth in taste. Not overpowering like most doubles. Also, I am not a huge fan of Hefes, but Fate's does not overdue the clove taste.

Great atmosphere and dog friendly patio.

Wow!!! First timers here. 

Sunday "brunch" menu, which for $10, includes two 5 oz. glasses of their beer. Server was attentive, and pleasant, and also very patient. Ordered the 6" meat & potatoes skillet, which I thought was going to be a snack, and how I was wrong. The 6" skillet was about 2" thick, and YUMMY! Wife ordered margarita pizza, and it was awesome on site, as well as for left overs this evening. Between the service, beer, price and food, it was definitely a 4+ star.  For the $30 bill between us (we each had an additional beer for $4/each) I thought it was awesome food, reasonable price, and great service, and very conveniently located.

The best in the Valley.
With the explosion of breweries, it is nice to see one that is focused on the beer they produce.  Probably one of the smallest in size and production capacity, but this brewery consistently puts out some great tap offerings.
The food complements the beer perfectly.  A nice small menu that works very well with the space.

Great place to spot by and try. They have a selection of beers that they brew themselves on sight and a handful of beers from different breweries. Some friends got the beer batter chicken tenders and they looked really good.

Well I'm happy to say this place has improved A TON since my last visit. They now have beer descriptions, two TVs and excellent service and food.

The beer was fantastic! 5 tasting flight for $8 is a good deal. Loved the Hatch Cream Ale, the Double IPA is amazing, the Milk Porter is fantastic.  Tried the Sizzurp on the first day of tapping and it's very good but a little sweet.

The Jess pizza is great. Cooked in a wood fired oven. Great balance of flavors.

The potato "nachos" are very good too but need hot sauce or red pepper flakes.

Place was hopping on a Friday night. I'll definitely be back. Kudos to Fate for upping their game - big time.

Amazing craft beer and craft pizzas. Candy bar milk stout is my jam. The hot oil is great on everything. Steve McFate and his team hit a home run with this place. Looking forward to their new and bigger location opening soon I believe.

The hubsters and I came here on date night recently. It was around 6:15 on a Saturday night, and surprisingly slow. I had the Cream Ale and it was yummy. The husband tried the Session and Irish Red and liked both. We split the House salad which was bomb, the pizza bread which sucked, and the fennel sausage pizza which was good. The service was lacking until I spoke up and said we wanted some help, and then the guy was super polite and attentive. Was a little pushy in trying to get us to order...dude, just give me a couple minutes to look over the menu, okay? But all in all it was good and we love little breweries like this.
Good gastropub, my only complaint was they were out of their IPA but great service and atmosphere

friendly staff, excellent food. I had the capicola and jalapeno pizza and a pretzel appetizer. Draft selection is a little narrow which prevents 5 stars, but still very good beer regardless. I will definitely be back.

Thoroughly enjoy ourselves here.  We had several Fatality IPA beers and the meat pizza(the name evades me) the service was great.  One of the severs also recommended this habanero oil for the pizza and that was paramount to icing on a cake.  
The only reason they get 4/5 stars is because we had a conversation about better restaurants such as Ruth's Chris steakhouse and that would be a 5 in my book.   Eat here.  Drink here.  Be merry.

Just awesome!  I am sure I over use this word but it is fitting!  They have a huge variety of beer on tap and let me tell you the green chili brew does not disappoint!  YUMMA!  The pizzas are so good, thin crust and creative.  My husband is a meat man so he ordered the sausage which was really tasty and had a big smoke flavor.  I ordered the grape escape because it sounded weird and was the bomb!  Roasted grapes, honey balsamic, cheese...ridick!  Our friend had a salad and whatever that highly addictive basil citrus dressing was I could not get enough!  You have to try this joint!

Stopped by as our first stop in Scottsdale for a friends vacation! Service was great. Waiter very sweet and accommodating. I got the burger - nothing wrong with the taste but when it comes to price in regards of the size of the patty, very disappointing. Definitely not worth what I paid. Great beer and happy hour but will not be returning for the burger!

Finally writing a short review after many visits!  Recent Fennel and Sausage Flatbread very, very good.  Service fast and consistent.  Great beers especially the Hatch Cream Ale (great aroma and taste!)  Whenever owner is there he always recognizes you and thanks you for coming.  Nice.

Love this place!Jalapeño biznaz pizza is incredible. The beer menu is awesome. Fabulous atmosphere and an amazing place to have a quick bite to eat. Highly recommended!!!!  

End note: this place truly is the "biznaz"

The beer is pretty darn good. I tried the double IPA and the ESP. Both were very smooth and flavorful. The ambience is great, and the bartender was really friendly. Only problem was the pizza was not great - a little too greasy.

Went to the location for the very delicious pizza found an amazing selection of beer that they brew met Misti who is just amazing, she lights up the whole place would recommend five stars wish yelp had a thousand stars because I'd ask for a thousand more

The pizza was fantastic and most of the beers were pretty good.   The smoked porter was my favorite.   The menu is a bit thin and could be due to the place testing out the kitchen.  It would be nice to see more than one appetizer and pairing suggestions would be a nice addition.   A partnership with the BBQ joint next door could add a new dynamic, like braising the BBQ meats with the smoked porter.  The service staff was prompt and friendly, even with a good crowd in the house.  If you've been curious about this place, definitely check it out.
Great pizza, great atmosphere, and awesome beer! Definitely recommend the 'Oh My Gatos! Golden Ale.'

Popped in with a few friends while visiting Scottsdale for the day and had an excellent beer bloody mary. The mix on it waa great had a nice kick to start my day off right. I tried the standard IPA and it was delicious. Very refreshing and not overly hoppy and heavy with a nice citrus hint! (Perfect for a hot day if you dont want a lighter beer) Also tried a sample of the oatmeal double IPA which is wonderful. Service and atmosphere are nice. I would come back and try the pizza we didnt eat but it looked amazing!

Fairly small place with a small patio. Nice decor. Not many parking spaces because of the other businesses in their parking lot.  Service was very good however the beer was thin and watery and the food was rather small portions. Overall not a bad place but not a great place.

Friendly service. Drinking the Porch Pilz. Great taste. Great finish. 
Lots of outdoor seating. 
Great location
Will be back.
Fantastic beer, great service, a variety of tasty meals and light snacks. Can't go wrong here. Salads, pizza, burgers, sandwiches. Did I mention the exceptional service

At 74th Street and Shea Boulevard in Scottsdale, a combination of brewery, pizzeria and pub, Fate's emphasis is on small-batch beer and wood-fired pies, according to founder and master brewer Steve McFate. He previously was with Colorado Boy Pub & Brewery in Ridgway, Colo., and promises Valley beer lovers a lineup of rotating traditional favorites, experimental recipes, seasonal brews and casks on tap.

Happy Hour brought me $3 Fate Belgian Saison Farmhouse Ale. Poured a golden colored body, into a rinsed tulip glass. Classic barnyard flavors of hay, earth and spices from the Belgian yeast and crisp malt. Very enjoyable.

There is a rotation of beers from light to dark. I did sample the smoked porter which had a distinctive smoke flavour imparted by using malted barley dried over an open flame. An excellent dark beer.

Fate Growlers were up on the shelves and also now have Growlettes which is 1 liter of delicious beer for only $12 New and $8 to Refill.

I, along with a few colleagues went to Fate based on a Google search...when we walked in, I didn't have great expectations as the place wasn't very busy.  I was the designated driver, so I didn't try any of the beers they had, but the wood fired pizza was amazing!  I got the Drunken Jess...only have one word to describe it...YUM!  also got the 'Twists of Fate'...their hot pretzels and beer cheese.
..oh my were these good!!!if in Scottsdale, you have to stop in...you will Not be disappointed.

We always have a good time here. Delicious food, great atmosphere, and a nice selection of beers. Although the last two times we visited. The beers we wanted to check out were gone but still listed on the menu. It happens, so we're not upset. The service was a bit slow to start but changed after our appetizers came out. Highly recommended to visit here!

Great to have a brewpub so close!  Have tried this place a few times and each time, just want to turn back around and go back!!
Great beer selection with frequent rotation. They also offer some great offering from other local and nonlocal brewers. 
Staff friendly and beer smart, which is a plus. 
Food menu, although not extensive, is fantastic with their wood fired pies and clever apps. 
Not a big place so try to get there when they open or you may have to fight off other beer aficionados for a table. (We went on Fathers day. Got there when it opened and ten minutes later, they had a 20 min wait).
So I urge anyone who likes to eat and/or drink to try Fate!

This place is great. Not the typical craft brewpub type of place. They have a pretty large selection of their own beers and great other beers on draft. They are kind of outside the box when it comes to style of beers. Adding a little twist to each one I think. 

It's not all about beer here though. Their food is excellent. I am not a big fan of breaded and fried food usually. McFate's is the exception for me though. The fish sandwich is amazing. The beer batter is light and just tastes so much better than most places. 

If you like great craft beer, but also like high quality food this is the place for you.

I went to Fate last Monday and I want to go back again! 

I had the Pablo Honey Pizza....so good...and to drink I had the Totes McOats. It was the perfect combination. 

Great spot with great pizza and beer!

Great beer and above average food. I went on a jam packed day and the owner was very helpful in taking care of us. He made sure we got our beers and held a spot for us on the waiting list. After ten minutes or so, we were able to get a spot at the bar. The gf went to find him and let him know we were taken care of and he remembered her name. Again, this was during a very crazy time (Candy Stout) so it was nice. The prices were reasonable and we had The Jess for the pizza. If I lived closer, this would be my go to spot.

Cool place to hang out! This will be a regular spot for me once I move back to the area. Great pizza, great beer....no complaints here at all. Well developed flavors in regards to the pizza toppings along with a swell crust made it awesome. Beers with tasty hop/malt blends, skillfully crafted, quenched my thirst. 
All around great place!

I've been here before and it's a cool small joint. I had the cake beer the last time I was here which was delicious but this time I decided to have food. Not a large menu but the pizza struck me so I got the build your own. Just a plain pepperoni pizza. Much to my surprise it was delicious and this is not their specialty. I was pleasantly surprised. Maybe next time I'll have pizza and beer.
Here for a second try.. No Fate IPA at all. Pretty disappointed to settle with the Dragoon, but the Pizza looks good.

**EDIT**

Within hours of my original review (below), I was contacted by the owner of Fate. He apologized for my experience and offered to make it right, and for that, my opinion of this company is vastly improved. It's very refreshing to know that an owner listens to their customers and seeks to improve in areas where they may fall short. You never get a second chance to make a first impression, but the response I received from the owner is certainly a large step in the right direction. 

_____________________
My girlfriend and I are HUGE beer lovers, she works at a brewery and has worked at a few different ones for the past 5+ years. We were in the Phoenix area so she could take her Cicerone exam at Crescent Crown, and we were heading up to Sedona for the next couple days. We visit breweries/brewpubs multiple times every week, and since we live in San Diego I'd like to think that we've seen a lot when it comes to the craft beer scene (I'm not trying to brag at all, just hoping to provide a context to show that we're not new to the idea/business of craft beer). We approach every new brewery with an open mind/palate, and go from there. And so it begins... 

We showed on a Saturday (3/15) early afternoon to find a half-full bar and a decent amount of people at the tables, so we grabbed a couple seats at the bar. The bartender (guy with dark hair, didn't get a name) told us he'd be with us in a minute (he seemed a little frazzled), so I told him there was no rush and we started looking over the menu. A couple minutes later he comes over and asks how he can help us. I asked him if they do tasting flights (since I didn't see the option on the menu), and he *literally* rolled his eyes, let out an audible chuckle/sigh, and said yes. I was immediately pretty put off, but figured I'd let it slide since they were supposed to have good beer. I asked "Do we build our own or is it a set number for a certain price?", to which he replied "Well what do you want?" with an attitude resembling a condescending teacher talking to 5 year old. 

At this point we should have left since his attitude was disgusting, but I genuinely wanted to try their beer. We ordered one flight to share and it was brought to us very quickly, which was nice. After the first taste I realized neither of us had water and we wanted a glass to cleanse the palate a little between styles. I asked the same bartender if we could each have a glass of water (a common request?), and he opens the fridge and puts down a carafe of water with two glasses, all without saying a word. I would have settled for a "here you go", but the silence was awkward and even more off-putting. At this point, I'm pretty much ready to pay the bill and leave; we're patronized by a worker AT A BREWERY by asking to try their beer, and we're treated rudely for having the audacity to ask for a glass of water. What's the deal with this place?

We stayed, and tried the Single Hop Sour, Hefeweizen, Table Saison, Chocolate Chili Milk Stout, and one more...can't remember (American Amber?). The beer was decent but nothing jumped out at me. I'm not a fan of hot spice/chilis in beer, but I appreciated the flavor of the chocolate against the chili in the stout. That is the only good thing I can say about this place. If I had to pick another, I'd say the parking lot was pretty clean and the pizza oven thing looked pretty cool, so thumbs up for that. 

This was the 4th brewery we stopped at in Arizona (out of 6 total), and it was the only one that literally left a bad taste in my mouth. I blame the service more than the beer, but I preferred the drinks at our other stops more anyways. 

We'll certainly be back in Phoenix (friends and cousins live there), but we will not return here and will not recommend this place to anyone back home. 

As a tip to management, I'd recommend ensuring that your staff talk to their customers like they are adults, not children. Either that, or don't hire workers that are clearly not enjoying their job; they're damaging your brand and only making your competitors look better.

I really wanted to like this place more. After 1 visit, I just wasn't impressed (with the beer or food). They have a decent IPA, but we had to send one of our appetizers back because the potatoes were burnt. It came out a second time and was still a little too crispy. I'm waiting for something to compell me to give it another shot, but until then... ***3 Stars.

Fantastic pizza, and even better beer. Do yourself a favor and go here. Honestly. 
So good, I've gone two nights in a row.
Their Imperial IPA is right up there with the best (e.g Stone Ruination).  Their Imperial Coffee Milk Porter is second to none - real coffee flavor. 
Nice and small, cozy, friendly... love it!

I'm a craft beer lover and I have a new favorite brewery.

We've been going here about once a week since they've opened.

Their beer is incredible!  I particularly like the slowly rotating lineup of Fate beers.  Some of my favorites so far... the Brown, Imperial IPA, Cream Ale, Irish Red, Oatmeal Stout, Belgian Saison and Pale Ale.

But man can't live on beer alone.  I think that we've tried all of their pizzas, every one delicious.  My favorites here are the... Rustica, Molto Carne, Capicola, Mediterranean and Fennel Sausage.

The staff, friendly and helpful - the atmosphere casual and comfortable.  And for desert, awesome little cake pops.

You must go here! Everybody is friendly. They have the best chocolate stout (forgot the name of it). And, the goat cheese pizza and salad were amazing. Better than the place that's on  Drive ins, Diners and Dives show. :)

I came here a while back with some buddies and I always would get their flight of beers! The servers and bartenders are always helpful in my selection and you can NOT go wrong with their pizzas! Can't wait to go back!
Beers were solid, loved the Chocolate Milk Stout! Split a margherita pizza which was ok, the chile oil is really nice though. Service was friendly. I would return if it wasn't so far from my house.

I guess I'm one of those people who either hate it, love it, or dont write about it...but this place was amazing!  the restaurant is small but busy. the beer is great and the fire oven pizza is heaven. I was raving about it for days and I literally cant wait for my next cheat meal to go again!
Great soft opening! Service was excellent. Thank you Terry. Beer and pizza also great. Looking forward to  all the beers.  Met Steve the owner and I'm super excited about all the possibilities!

We love this place - this comment is specific to tonight. We came in with the Kid, her friend, and her friend from school. Service was a bit slow and when our friend wanted to take a pizza to go - something she asked about when she ordered her dinner - she was told that there was no dough thawed and she'd need to wait another 20-minutes.

Not a huge deal, but this is the 2nd odd thing (pizza's not made right a few weeks ago) that has happened at our favorite local pizza and beer place since the new GM came in.

We will keep coming in because the beer is amazing and we like the food and the vibe. This is merely a quality check....
This brewery is pretty dope. I like the IPA's but I'd stay away from those potato nachos. Good service, looks more like a restaurant. Overall a good place to chill and drink beer.

Fate Brewing Company caught my eye as I was driving down Shea, so I decided to stop in last night. It turns out it was their soft opening and everything seemed to run very smoothly. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The decor is modern - a bit of the industrial look with a lot of concrete and wood, but it managed to feel warm, not sterile. They have a wood fired oven and offer a variety of pizzas. I tried the margherita and it was perfect to share as an appetizer/light meal. It was a thin crust and the ingredients were very fresh. They have a wine list with regional wines and brew about 5 of their own beers. Most of their beers were described as hoppy, which I'm not a huge fan of, but the cream ale I got was pretty good (a little bitter for me, but I think beer connoisseurs would appreciate it). They also feature other regional brews. Overall, I think this will be a great little classy hangout spot!

I love this place.  People are friendly and the atmosphere is welcoming.  The reason for 5 stars for me is the pizza!  Literally the best pizza I've ever had.  Get the "Jess" pizza.  Add jalapeños.  BOMB!  You won't be disappointed!
My favorite micro brew! Have Been going since they opened, and I absolutely love Fate.

Fate Brewing Company brews small batch beers brewed on location. They have a rotating list of 10 Fate beers and space for two guest beers on tap. When I payed a visit, I ordered a beer flight and tasted five of their top beers that day. My favorite was the Coffee Milk Porter with coffee from Cartel Coffee Lab in the recipe! I took a growler home for the boyfriend to try! 

Travis gave me a tour of the brewery and introduced me to the brewer Adam! He's in charge of beer flavor creativity and I must say he does a good job! He started out in culinary school and found himself interested in brewing. The brewery also has a kitchen that specializes in wood-fired pizza. Yum!

I can't wait to go back and see what beers they have on tap next!
Pizza is outstanding! Best pizza for a bar I've ever had in my entire life! The beer is just as good, they have a chili beer that refreshing, spicy and absolutely delightful!

Fate is... well, it's okay.

Came here with some friends on a Saturday night a few weeks back. It was about 7PM and the restaurant was pretty packed. It took a few minutes for a host to come up to us and let us know it'd be a few minutes. We sat outside and it truly was less than a 10 minute wait before a table opened up. Awesome! I had worked all day and was excited (and ready) to order some appetizers.

Unfortunately, it'd be quite a while before that happened. It took at least ten minutes (probably closer to twenty) for a server to make their way to our table. When he did finally get to us, he was friendly enough. We ordered two beer flights and two sodas, the soft pretzels with beer cheese fondue, and the Irish nachos. The beer flights came out decently quickly, along with the sodas. The beers were just all right. The pale ale was pretty good - nice, light, and smooth. The beet beer divided our table, with two of us liking it and the other two (myself included) really disliking it. I chalk that up to not quality level, but more just specific taste preferences. The other beers were pretty forgettable. Not bad, but not overwhelmingly delicious either.

I had been craving a soft pretzel for weeks and Fate's did not disappoint. The pretzels were piping hot and had a great "crust," with a super soft inside. The beer cheese fondue was AWESOME. Nice and hot, just the right amount of beer / cheese. I not only used it for the pretzels, but also for the Irish nachos, which were delicious but lacking a bit. With the beer cheese fondue they were pretty delicious, though! 

When our appetizers came, we ordered our pizzas. It felt like there was quite a lag between when we ordered our dinners and when they ended up coming, and at this point the house had emptied out significantly. My husband and I got the veggie pizza. It was pretty good (nothing overly spectacular). He didn't like the crust (which was buttery and salty, maybe a little too thin), but I did. Our friends got the Popper pizza and liked it, but we all agreed it wasn't anything to write home about.

Overall, I was definitely expecting more. I definitely came in with a mindset of comparing it to Four Peaks Brewing, and it unfortunately did not live up to that standard - in food, beer, or service. I will probably try the new location out and give it another shot - hopefully we'll be surprised and love it next time around!

Yay beer! Some neat stuff, too. Beet juice saison? Well, okay, then. The Irish red is solid. One of their guest ciders wasn't as described, but it wasn't bad. The stout was hearty and intense. 

Their beer size options are flexible - flights are affordable, half-pints are an option, and you can taste before you decide. Our service was good. The venue itself is a bit blah, but that's forgiveable with the beer and the people.

We liked most of the food. Solid salad, satisfying comfort Irish Nachos, friends liked their pizza. The "Toasted Mozz" were just boring. The bread was nicely crispy and the cheese was bubbled, but it was bread and cheese with a grape tomato. Also, that jarred oily mess of pesto was gross.

As I was finishing up my yelp reviews from a recent trip to Firestone Walker in Paso Robles, I was shocked to see i had not written about my new favorite brewery in AZ.

"FINALLY!  A BREWERY IN NORTH SCOTTSDALE..." is basically my reaction to Fate Brewery.  One "fateful" night (pun intended) when I decided to stop in to try their Imperial IPA, a love affair began that I don't anticipate ending anytime soon.

I will admit, at first, I was skeptcal.  There are so many places that have come and gone...there will always be the places that "have decent craft beer, for the area."  That was my initial hesitation upon opening, and is probably why it took me months to finally give them a try.  I was pleasantly surprised when the beer was one of the best I've had in the valley.

Although the location seems small, it's more than adequate.  Their patio is awesome in the cooler months.  They have enough tables where you never feel like you have to wait long, but never feel like it's too empty.  Personally I favor sitting at the bar, no matter where I go.  Their bar is really cool, and the chairs are spaced appropriately so you don't feel like you're sitting on top of the person next to you.

On to the important stuff, the beer.  I've noticed over the past few months, they have done a really good job of satisfying all palattes. Whether you're a hop head, or more of a fruit beer, or maybe something darker, there has been at least one of each on their menu.  I am a hop head through and through, and their American Pale Ale and recently released IPA are my favorite in Arizona right now.  They also often release specialty beers that have never disappointed (for instance, a coffee IPA).

I have only had pizza there, and it was great.  Love the hot chili oil.

The atmosphere to me is the closest you'll get to a "cheers" type of bar.  Maybe being from the east coast I'm more acclimated to this type of vibe, but it's small, quaint, welcoming, and inviting.  I have gone in with my husband, with my girlfriends, or sat by myself, and I've always felt comfortable, and have always met really cool people along the way.
